"expansion of information" Chinese character encoding character set
1 This document specifies the hexadecimal representation of the Chinese graphic characters and the binary code for information technology.
This document is applicable to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output of Chinese and other character information.

This document is applicable to technical products with the function of information processing and exchange of Chinese and other characters, including but not limited to software products represented by input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, speech synthesis, character transcription, and writing, as well as handy products represented by computers, communication terminals, e-book readers, and learning machines.
2 normative reference documents
The following documents are normative references. The content of these documents is an essential part of this document.

Among them, the referenced document with a date is applicable to this document only for the version corresponding to the date; the referenced document without a date is applicable to this document for the latest edition (including all amendments).
GB/T 2312-1980 “Information exchange code for Chinese characters” basic set
GB/I 11383-1989 Information Processing "Code Structure and Encoding Rules for Information Exchange

3 Terms and definitions
The following definitions and abbreviations such apply in this document.
3.1 character
an element of a set of elements used to organize, control, or represent data.
3.2 編碼字符 coded character
character (3.1) and its encoding are shown.
3.3 private use area
an area of the character set that a user of a product that conforms to this document can define for his or her own use.
3.4 repertoire
a set of specified characters (3.1) represented by a set of encoding characters (3.2).
3.5 reserved zone
reserved for future use in accordance with this document.
4 vocabulary
4.1 Overview
The characters in this document are encoded in single-byte, double-byte, or four-byte code.
The single-byte part includes all 128 characters from 0x00 to 0x7F in GB/T 11383-1989.
4.3 Two-byte characters
The double-byte part includes all graphic characters in GB/T 2312-1980, all CJK unified ideographs in GB/T 13000, and some graphic characters.
The characters of the double-byte part are in accordance with the provisions of Appendix A.
Among them, the graphic, code position and function of ideographic character descriptor should meet the requirements of Appendix B.
Note: GB/T 13000 is a unified encoding for Chinese characters used in China, Japan, Korea, Vietnam, etc.
The characters with unique abstract forms are assigned with individual code positions, and the characters with the same abstract forms but different sources are assigned with the same code positions.
The encoded Chinese characters are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK stands for China, Japan and Korea.
4.4 Four-byte part

The four-byte portion includes 66 CJK unified ideographs (9FA6-9FEF, excluding 8 characters from 9FB4-9FBB) from GB/T 13000, CJK unified ideographs extension A, CJK unified ideographs extension B, CJK unified ideographs extension C, CJK unified ideographs extension D, CJK unified ideographs extension E, and characters of ethnic minority languages that have been encoded in GB
The characters in the four-byte part are in accordance with the provisions of Appendix C.
5 Overall Structure of the System
In the text, any number preceded by 0x indicates hexadecimal, and any number not preceded by 0x indicates decimal.
Hexadecimal notation is used to represent all codes in the appendix, and decimal notation is used to represent other numbers.
The single-byte part adopts the encoding structure of GB/T 11383-1989, using the 0x00~0x7F code bits.

The double-byte part uses two eight-bit binary bit strings to represent a character, and the first byte code bit is from 0x81 to 0xFE, and the last byte code bit is 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE respectively.
The four-byte part uses 0x30-0x39, which are not used in GB/T 11383-1989, as the suffix for the double-byte encoding extension, and the encoding range is 0x81308130-0xFE39FE39.

The first byte of the four-byte character is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the second byte is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39; the third byte is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the fourth byte is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39. That is: 0x81308130 to 0x81308139; 0
The overall structure and code bit range allocation are shown in Figure 1 and Table 1.
6. The order of characters
6.1 The arrangement order of characters in the single-byte brush part
The characters of the single character part are arranged in the order of the corresponding characters in GB/I 11383-1989.
6.2 The arrangement order of the characters in the double-byte part
The order of the characters in the lower part of a double-byte character should be in accordance with Appendix A.
6.3 The arrangement order of the characters in the four-character brush part

From 0x81308130 to 0x8439FE39, a total of 50400 code points, corresponding to all the characters in the GB/T 13000 basic multilingual plane that are not included in the double-byte part, are arranged in the order of the corresponding characters in the GB/T 13000 basic multilingual plane.

From 0x90308130 to 0xE339FE39, a total of 1058400 code points are used for the corresponding 16 supplementary planes of GB/T 13000, and the character arrangement order is completely arranged in the order of the corresponding code points of the 16 supplementary planes of GB/T 13000.
The order of the characters in the four-byte part should meet the requirements of Appendix C.

8. Description of characters and codes
Compared with GB 18030-2005, the glyphs and/or the corresponding GB/TI 13000 codes at some code positions have been adjusted in this document (see Appendix D).
9.1 General Provisions
This document specifies three levels of implementation.
The system software product that meets the corresponding implementation level shall provide the input and output function of all characters in the corresponding implementation level range.
9.2 Implementation Level 1

implementation level 1 shall support the single-byte encoding part, double-byte encoding part, and four-byte encoding part of the CJK unified ideographs (i.e., 0x82358F33-0x82359636) and CJK unified ideographs extension A (i.e., 0x8139EE39-0x82358738) in this document.
Any product to which this document applies shall meet the requirements of Level 1.
Note: According to the needs of software application, the implementation level 1 can also choose any one or more of the non-Chinese scripts listed in Table 3.
9.3 Implementation Level 2
Level 2 implementation includes Level 1 implementation.
In addition, the implementation level 2 also supports the encoding characters that are not included in the implementation level 1 in the {General Standard Chinese Character Table}.
The code position and character form of the Chinese characters in the List of General Standard Chinese Characters in this document are shown in the appendix below.
The system software and supporting software should meet the requirements of level 2.
Note: system software and supporting software include but are not limited to operating systems, database management systems, middleware (see GB/T 36475 for software product classification).
9.4 Implementation Level 3
Level 3 implementation includes Level 2 implementation.
In addition, the implementation level 3 also supports all the characters in this document and the KangXi radicals in Table 3.
Products used for government services and public services shall meet the requirements of Level 3.

Note: the industries of government affairs service and public service include but are not limited to railway transport, road transport, water transport, aviation transport, intermodal transport and transportation agency, postal and telecommunications, currency and financial services, insurance, land management, health, national institutions, social security, etc. (the information of industry classification is shown in GB/ 工 4754).

The C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both use one or more of the four steps to process input files: preprocessing, compilation, assembly, and linking.
The file extension identifies the language of the source file, but to the compiler it controls the default settings:
gcc considers preprocessed files (.i) to be C files, and sets up C-style linking.

The suffix of the source file name indicates the language type and the subsequent operation:
.c C source program; preprocessing, compilation, assembling
.C C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.cc C++ 源程序; 預處理, 編譯,彙編
.CXX C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.m Objective-C source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.i Preprocessed c file; compile, assemble
.ii The preprocessed C++ file; compile, link
.s assembly language source program; assembler
Assembly language source program; preprocessing, assembling
.h preprocessor file; files that are not passed to the linker (Linker) on the command line are usually passed to the linker. Usually includes:
.0 Object file
.a archive file
unless the -cec, -s, or -E options are used (or a compilation error prevents the entire process), linking is the final step.

at link time, all the .e files, .o files, and .h files that correspond to the source program, as well as any unrecognized filenames (including the .o, .h, and .a files that were specified), are passed to the linker in the order they appear on the command line.

-fexternal-templates generates smaller code (for C++) by generating a copy of each template function (template function) only where they are defined.
To use this option successfully, you must mark `#pragma implementation' (definition) or `#pragma interface' (declaration) in all files that use templates.
When you compile a program with `-fexternal-templates', all template instantiations are external types. You must have the required instantiations appear in the implementation file.
this can be achieved with the use of the typedef element, which references each of the required instantiations.
Correspondingly, if the default option `-fno-external-templates' is used at compile time, all template instantiations are explicitly marked as internal.
All member functions (except constructors and the new or delete member operators) are treated as virtual functions of the class in which they are declared.
This does not mean that every member function call will go through the internal vtable.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a virtual function can be called directly; in this case, it is called directly.

After combining the user-defined free storage management mechanism into c++, the assignable `this' appears to be out of place.
Therefore, by default, assigning this in the body of a class member function is an invalid operation.
However, to maintain backward compatibility, you can make this operation effective by using the `-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char defines char as an unsigned type, just like unsigned char.
Each machine has its own default char type. It may be unsigned char or signed char.
In an ideal world, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char when the sign of the data matters.

However, many programs have already been written using only simple char, and they expect it to be a signed integer (or an unsigned integer, depending on the target machine on which the program is compiled).
This option, and its opposite, make such programs work with the corresponding default values.
the type of char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char , even if it behaves exactly the same as one of them.
If the ` signed' or ` unsigned' qualifier is not explicitly specified, these options are used to define signed or unsigned bit-fields.
By default, bit-fields are signed because they inherit their base integer type, such as int, which is signed. However, if the option `-traditional' is specified, bit-fields are always unsigned.
fwritable-strings stores string constants in the writable data segment, and treats them no differently.
This is to accommodate some old programs that consider string constants to be a very bad idea; the `-traditional' option has the same effect.

COVID-19's impact on the drug market
its impact may be similar to the 2008 economic crisis
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.

In many countries, this disease has overwhelmed health care systems and brought them to the brink of collapse, and the restrictions imposed by governments around the world have caused severe dislocations in the global economy.
The impact on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be profound.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to manufacture drugs as the restrictions on movement also restrict access to precursors and basic chemicals.
Traffickers who are unable to cross borders due to travel restrictions may have to find new routes and methods.
Patterns of drug use and provision may change, and governments' ability to respond may be hampered.
The changes brought about by Covid-19 are unprecedented, but there are lessons to be learned from previous crises.
After the 2008 financial crisis, some drug users began to seek cheaper synthetic substances and switched to injecting drugs.
Meanwhile, governments have been cutting budgets related to drugs.
If governments respond to the current economic downturn in the same way, interventions to prevent drug use and related risky behaviors, as well as treatment services, may be severely affected.
In addition, the priority of interdiction and international cooperation may be reduced, making it easier for traffickers to operate.
Some countries have large amounts of drugs smuggled through commercial flights, and it is expected that the direct impact on drug trafficking in these countries will be the greatest.

Methamphetamine and other synthetic drugs are often carried by couriers in carry-on bags or hidden in personal luggage, sometimes in large quantities. Because almost all commercial air travel has been restricted, the supply of drugs by commercial aviation may be completely interrupted.
Although the international postal supply chain has also been disrupted, the activities of drug trafficking using the dark web and parcel post may increase.
In the long term, economic recession and associated containment measures may disrupt the drug market.

As unemployment rates rise and opportunities dwindle, the poor and vulnerable are more likely to turn to harmful drug use, drug use disorders, and illicit activities related to drugs, whether production or trafficking.
Drug trafficking organisations may take advantage of this situation to provide services to vulnerable populations and recruit new members to bolster their ranks.
As governments' capacity to respond declines, these changes may take root quickly and become a new reality in many communities.
expansion and complexity
That breaks down into 2.8% growth outside of North America and 0.7% in North America.
the growth pattern of the population partly explains the expansion of the market
drug use has been increasing worldwide, both in absolute numbers and as a proportion of the overall population.

In 2009, an estimated 210 million people were drug users, representing 4.8% of the global population aged 15 to 64 years; in 2018, an estimated 269 million people were drug users, representing 5.3% of this population.
In the past two decades, the growth rate of drug use in developing countries has been far higher than that in developed countries.

This partly reflects the difference in overall population growth during this period, 7% in developed countries and 28% in developing countries, but also reflects the faster growth of young populations in developing countries.
The proportion of teenagers and young adults in drug users is the largest.
Between 2000 and 2018, the population in this age group in developing countries increased by 16%, while it decreased by 10% in developed countries.
1 Urbanization is a driving factor of the current and future drug market
Drug use is more prevalent in urban than in rural areas in both developed and developing countries.

The overall increase in drug use is partly due to the large-scale movement of population from rural areas to cities - currently more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, compared to 34% in 1960.
Urbanization is likely to be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, especially in developing countries where urbanization trends are more pronounced.

The increase in wealth is associated with an increase in drug use, but the burden of disease is greatest among the poorest people worldwide. In the developed world, drug use is more prevalent than in developing countries.
Cocaine and other drugs are more strongly associated with the world's wealthier regions.
Similarly, within countries, the prevalence of drug use is higher among the more affluent social groups.
But it is people with lower socioeconomic status who are more likely to develop a drug use disorder.
data from a few countries suggest that harmful patterns of drug use and disorders are associated with low income .
These patterns are less common in the more affluent social classes.
The economic constraints imposed by the global Covid-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risks faced by the most vulnerable, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment, have previously been associated with increases in drug use, and this pandemic has forced millions of people around the world out of work.

COVID-19 may lead to further expansion of the drug market The COVID-19 pandemic may lead to more farmers increasing or engaging in illegal crop cultivation, or because the control of the national authorities is weakened, or because more people may have to take risks in the economic crisis and engage in illegal activities.

The related restrictions of COVID-19 have led to a reduction in air and land traffic, and the sea trafficking may have increased as a result, as the risk of interception is low and the amount of trafficking is more than that by air or land.
Recent reports have indicated that cocaine shipments are being transported directly from South America to Europe by sea.
WE IMPROVE the ability of people to deal with complexity.
The situation with noncontrolled substances is stable, but the market for new, potentially dangerous synthetic opioids is growing. The drug market is becoming more complex.

In addition to plant-based substances such as cannabis, cocaine and heroin, hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added, many of which are not controlled internationally. Non-medical use of drugs is also increasing rapidly.
Member States' domestic markets have an annual turnover of around 500 new psychoactive substances.
At present, most of them are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a small amount of opioids.
While the overall number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized, the proportion has changed.
Of the total number of new psychoactive substances identified in 2014, only 2% were opioids, but this figure had risen to 9% by 2018.

Many of the novel psychoactive substances in the class of opioids are fentanyl analogues, and their pharmacological and toxicological properties have been proven, leading to overdose deaths in North America, and to a lesser extent in other regions.
In North America, fentanyl is used as an adulterant in heroin and other drugs (including cocaine and methamphetamine) and as a precursor for the manufacture of illicitly produced opioid analgesics.

Some evidence suggests that injection of new psychoactive stimulants is also occurring in Europe: a study of discarded syringes in six European cities found that many contained substances that produce stimulant effects. "
2. The use of new psychoactive substances may become firmly entrenched in disadvantaged groups
single new psychoactive substance has rarely formed a large market.
but evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among socially marginalized groups such as the homeless and prisoners .
Twenty-two countries reported use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with synthetic cannabinoids identified as the main challenge in most of these countries.

control of precursor chemicals forces drug producers to innovate. Many chemicals that are commonly used as precursors to synthesize amphetamine, methamphetamine, and “ecstasy” have been placed under international control.

Drug traffickers and chemists have been looking for alternatives - not just substances with less stringent controls, but also chemicals specifically designed to evade controls, so-called "special purpose precursors".
Restrictive measures aimed at preventing the spread of Covid-19 are likely to further squeeze the drug makers who rely on precursor chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico suggests that this is already happening: reports suggest that a shortage of methamphetamine precursors imported from East Asia in March 2020 led to price increases for methamphetamine in both Mexico and the United States.
in a fast-moving market.
Synthetic drugs replace opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
The opiate market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have changed between 2008 and 2018.
the number of persons treated for opioid use disorder in the Russian Federation fell by about 80 % , while the amount of opioids seized by the authorities declined by about 80 % .
But the stimulant market seems to be booming.
There is evidence that methamphetamine and various cathinones, including mephedrone and a-pyrrolidinobenzylpentanone, are now readily available on the Russian drug market.
Russian authorities reported a sharp rise in the number of secret laboratories manufacturing a variety of illicit drugs, doubling in two years to 152 in 2018.
Methamphetamine markets in Afghanistan and Iraq grow
As early as 2012, surveys of personnel in hospitals, prisons and other institutions had revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq.
Crystal meth has become a major drug of concern alongside fentanyl and tramadol.
A study in 2015 further confirmed these findings, with users saying that cannabis was harder to get than "Captagon" or methamphetamine.

Recently, the Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine processing sites, and the International Narcotics Control Board has expressed concern about the large-scale import of pseudoephedrine preparations, which are used as precursors by methamphetamine processing sites.
In Afghanistan, the production of methamphetamine appears to have started in 2014.
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have been steadily rising.
But the amount seized in the first half of 2019 - 657 kg - was a huge jump on the previous year.
Large quantities of crystallized methamphetamine have been seized in several countries and there has also been a significant increase in seizures of Ecstasy in the region.
policy changes and trends
The jurisdictions that have legalized the non-medical use of cannabis have seen an increase in cannabis use.
Canada, Uruguay and 11 jurisdictions in the United States allow the production of cannabis products for non-medical use.
In most of these jurisdictions, cannabis use has increased since legalization, although similar trends have been observed in jurisdictions that have not legalized nonmedical cannabis use.

In the two states in the United States that were the first to legalize cannabis for nonmedical use, Colorado and Washington, the prevalence of cannabis use among adults has increased, particularly in the past month and among those who use cannabis daily or almost daily, since 2012, exceeding the national average.
All indicators show that cannabis use in Uruguay has increased since 2011, with use in the past month nearly doubling.
This suggests that the increase is mainly due to more frequent and frequent use of cannabis.
Short-term data from Canada also suggest that use increased as the legal market expanded from 2018 to 2019.
However, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products from illegal sources in 2019.
Has cannabis legalization caused a global drop in cannabis seizures?
In 2018, global seizures of cannabis herb fell to their lowest level in 20 years, owing to a reduction in the quantity seized in North America, which fell by 84% over the past decade.

By contrast, seizures in the rest of the world almost doubled during the same period. The pattern of seizures suggests that policies aimed at liberalising the cannabis market played a key role in the decline.
Regulation of new psychoactive substances appears to have had a dampening effect on the domestic market for new psychoactive substances, although it is difficult to assess the extent of this effect.
Some countries with different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances show different rates of use of these substances.
In other countries, use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after domestic legislation.
the use of drugs for pain management and palliative care is mainly provided in high @-@ income countries , and the distribution of these drugs is uneven across regions .
in 2018 , more than 90 % of the medically available opioids were in high @-@ income countries .
about 50% in North America , 40% in Europe , and 2% in Oceania .
These countries account for approximately 12% of the world's population .
It is estimated that the population of low- and middle-income countries accounts for 88% of the global population, but the consumption of pharmaceutical opioids is less than 10%.
barriers to access to opioid analgesics are associated with many factors, including legislation, culture, health systems, and prescribing practices .
People who are poorer are more likely to have a substance use disorder. In 2018, an estimated 3.56 million people had a substance use disorder.

Poverty , limited education , and social marginalization may increase risk for substance use disorders and exacerbate their consequences . This is supported by research in high @-@ income countries , which shows that an individual 's adverse socioeconomic trajectory -- not just their circumstances at a given point in time -- is associated with risk for substance use disorders .

Substance use disorders also deepen social and economic disadvantage, further increasing the risk of unemployment, poverty and homelessness, thereby perpetuating the cycle of disadvantage. These outcomes may also be related to stigmatizing attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women , ethnic minorities and migrants , sexual and gender minorities , people displaced by armed conflict or disaster , and people in rural settings may also be disproportionately affected by substance use disorders or have difficulties accessing treatment services .

the number of years of healthy life lost because of disability due to disease or injury, as estimated by the disability @-@ adjusted life @-@ year ( DALY ) indicator , has increased in the past decade , with the harmful effects of drug use extending to a broader range of social consequences .
the global burden of disease attributable to drug use increased by 17 % between 2007 and 2018 .
the increase in the number of disability @-@ adjusted life @-@ years lost to liver cancer associated with untreated hepatitis C among people who inject drugs was particularly high , at 40 % .
The links between drug use and violence are complex and difficult to determine all the causal relationships between the use of psychoactive substances and violence.
limited global data suggest that intoxication may be an important factor in homicide .
However, alcohol appears to have a greater role in violent events than drugs.

Although drug use may lead to crime, in some cases this association can be partly attributed to multiple mediating factors, such as socioeconomic disadvantage and other types of adversity caused by individual risk, family environment and peer influences.
the link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted .
if a stable criminal structure is in place , large @-@ scale organized crime activities , including international drug trafficking , may be carried out without violence .

In the short term, the presence and extent of violence are more a function of changes that destabilize the balance of power among organized crime groups than of the volume of trafficking. These changes include fluctuations in the size of the illegal market, the death or incarceration of prominent criminals, and law enforcement actions that weaken one group relative to another.
View the latest trends
Marijuana is most commonly used substance, opioids most harmful
However, the most widely used drug globally continues to be cannabis, with an estimated 188 million people having used the drug in 2017.
By comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
But the harms associated with opioids are often overlooked because of their lower prevalence.

Of the estimated 167,000 deaths in 2017 associated with drug use disorders, 66% were caused by these substances, and 50% of the 21 million years of healthy life lost to disability or premature death due to drug use were caused by these substances.
Non-medical use of synthetic opioids exacerbates public health crisis

Tramadol is driving the opioid crisis in West, Central and North Africa, while fentanyl is the main driver in North America. These two regions have little in common in terms of economic, demographic or general patterns of drug use, but both are struggling with the opioid crisis fueled by the availability of cheap and easy-to-produce substances.
In North America, the use of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids has led to a 20 @-@ year increase in opioid overdose deaths.
Of the 67,367 overdose deaths registered in the United States in 2018 , two thirds involved fentanyl .
Canada has reported similar results, albeit at a lower level.
Fentanyl contributes to overdose deaths in part because of the unpredictable potency of fentanyl in the illegal drug market.
In West Africa, Central Africa and North Africa, the market for nonmedical use of tramadol has grown substantially.
In the region, the number of patients treated for tramadol use disorder is increasing.
In 2017, global seizures of tramadol reached a peak of more than 125 tonnes.
But in 2018, global seizures fell to 32 tons after India passed a new law regulating tramadol.
The two crises are driven by the ease of manufacture and low cost of production, as well as the lack of international regulation of tramadol and many fentanyl analogues and precursors.
What makes these crises worse is that these substances are available in both the legal and illegal markets, making them harder to detect and prevent from being abused.
Stimulant use on the rise
The stimulant field is dominated by cocaine and methamphetamine, both of which are on the rise in their main markets.
In 2018, about 19 million people used cocaine, because it is popular in North America and Western Europe.
Approximately 27 million people used amphetamine that year, with methamphetamine being the most commonly used form of amphetamine in Southeast Asia and North America.
Based on the majority of indicators, methamphetamine use has been expanding in both regions for the past 20 years.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist, sometimes as substitutes, so that when the use of one drug increases, the use of the other decreases, and sometimes both increase and decrease to meet the demand of the same market.
COVID-19 raises risks for injection drug users
An estimated 11.3 million people injected drugs in 2018, and 10% of the world's HIV infections are caused by injection drug use.
Approximately 1.6 million people who inject drugs have HIV and 6.1 million have Hepatitis C
In 2017, about 585,000 people died from drug use, half of them from liver disease caused by hepatitis C, while most people who inject drugs still have not been treated for hepatitis C.
The opioid shortage caused by COVID @-@ 19 restrictions may lead users to substitute alcohol or benzodiazepines or other more readily available substances or to mix opioids with synthetic drugs .
As some users switch to injecting or inject more frequently, there may be more harmful use patterns.

EU Summit Debates Refugee Policy, EU Officials: Reception Process Faces Bottlenecks-ChinaNews.com
EU summit over refugee policy: every step in the reception process is a bottleneck

[Global Times reporter in Belgium, Niurui Fei] According to the report of Agence France-Presse on February 10, at the latest EU summit on the same day, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said that EU leaders agreed to adopt stricter policies on illegal immigration to facilitate the deportation of illegal immigrants.

According to the report, the EU's move is a response to the growing problem of illegal immigration in Europe. Currently, the core problem of the EU is that the number of illegal immigrants who can be deported is very small.

According to the summit document, the EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" to strengthen the external border by means of infrastructure and surveillance.
However, the EU and its member states have been arguing over who should pay for the fencing.
Von der Leyen reiterated that the EU funds will not pay for the related expenses.

But some diplomatic officials of member states said that if the EU can share the part of installing cameras, watchtowers and other facilities along the external border, it will give each country the national budget to speed up the construction.

The European Euractiv website said that EU officials admitted that there were bottlenecks in every step of the refugee reception process, and the limited reception capacity and the overwhelmed immigration authorities of member states could not stop the refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in all EU countries, and the EU's refugee reception system was in a state of "permanent crisis".

According to the estimate of the European Commission, the Schengen countries of the European Union received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, an increase of nearly 50% from the previous year.
At the same time, the EU recorded more than 330,000 illegal entries last year.

Against this background, the summit also reached an agreement on a "principle" that EU countries can deport illegal immigrants to their home countries based on the court judgment of another member country.
In addition, the report said that the EU leaders also agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries", which would pave the way for the EU to formulate a common list.
Source: @EduardKovacs @softpedia (author: Niurui Fei)
US Upgrades "Chip War" to Deal a Heavy Blow to Global Semiconductor Industry - chinanews.com

Recently, the US "chip war" has been upgraded - first, the Netherlands and Japan agreed to start controlling the export of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China under the pressure of the US; then, according to foreign media reports, the US government is considering cutting off all links between US suppliers and Huawei, prohibiting US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei; the Biden administration is also preparing to issue an executive order to limit US investment in sensitive Chinese technology industries... At the beginning of 2023

In recent years, the United States has never stopped its attacks on China's semiconductor development. On the one hand, it has targeted the semiconductor supply chain of China, and on the other hand, it has built a semiconductor industry chain alliance to "de-Chinese" the industry. It is trying to "leave China behind" in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is to solicit South Korea to establish a "technical alliance" or to establish a chip "quadrilateral alliance" with South Korea, Japan and Taiwan, or to establish a semiconductor industry chain "small circle" through the "Quad Mechanism" and "Indo-Pacific Economic Framework" and other mechanisms, the United States has introduced political, camp and weaponized means into the semiconductor industry in an attempt to build a closed production and supply chain cycle dominated by the United States
However, the US’s large-scale “chip war” against China is also “a thousand injured, self-damaged eight hundred”.

Recently, the US well-known chip manufacturing equipment supplier Applied Materials announced that it would lay off 1,300 full-time employees and plan to lay off 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters due to the latest round of export ban on China’s chip manufacturing equipment.

Recently, the Dutch ASML Holding Co., the world's leading manufacturer of photolithography equipment, warned that the ban on exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China may lead to an increase in semiconductor prices.

According to the US media analysis, after the US government implemented the brutal pressure on the Chinese chip and semiconductor industries, many US companies have been harmed, including electronic design automation tool developers, chip designers, wafer manufacturing equipment producers, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The United States' so-called suppression of China's advanced semiconductor industry has dragged the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain down.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry, and has long formed a closely linked global semiconductor industry chain.

According to professional estimates, based on specialized division of labor, the entire production process of semiconductor products needs to cross national borders more than 70 times, and the whole process takes 100 days.
Although the US semiconductor industry has a strong foundation, it is relatively weak in manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced process technology, and is heavily dependent on East Asia.

Even if the United States vigorously guides the advanced chip supply chain to the "small circle" regional development led by the United States, it is difficult to change the regional distribution and interdependence of the global semiconductor related industries.
The U.S. is strongly "restructuring" and "de-Chinese" the semiconductor industry chain, which has seriously damaged the global semiconductor industry.
Chip is the core of the future global industry, and the development of the chip industry cannot be separated from the participation of all countries in the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, successively introducing the Innovation and Competition Act, the 2022 U.S. Competition Act, and the Chip and Science Act, using its technological hegemony to consolidate its technological leadership; and using both sticks and carrots to coerce Intel, TSMC, Samsung, and other chip manufacturing enterprises to set up factories in the United States, and is doing its utmost to ensure the United States’ global leadership in
In the short term, the United States has indeed caused trouble for China’s semiconductor industry and related industries, and reaped real benefits.

However, in the long run, the US’s hysterical suppression will force China’s chip industry to make breakthroughs continuously, and it will lose the huge Chinese market, which will eventually weaken the innovation will and innovation ability of American technology enterprises, and harm the development of the global chip industry.
Gao Qiao
First batch of individual pension fund financial products go on sale. The shortest holding period is 360 days - chinanews.com
First batch of personal pension financial products go on sale
Seven products from domestic institutions are available for selection. The minimum duration is 60 days, maximum duration is 360 days.
The personal pension fund financial products have finally been launched.

On February 10, China Finance Net released the list of the first batch of personal pension finance products. The seven personal pension finance products of Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Finance, Agricultural Bank of China Finance and China Post Finance are officially on sale.

At this point, the "shelf" of personal pension accounts has finally gathered four types of products, including personal pension savings, personal pension financial products, personal pension insurance, and personal pension public fund.

It is reported that the first batch of personal pension fund financial products are all open-ended net asset value products of public offering, including 5 newly issued products and 2 existing products. Except for one mixed product, the rest 6 products are fixed income products.

Beijing Youth Daily reporter saw that 4 of the 5 newly issued products came from Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Wealth Management, and all were fixed-income products. The shortest holding period was 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance comparison benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% - 4.60%, 4.40% - 4

The remaining new issue product is "Postal Bank Wealth Add Yihongjing Shortest Holding 1095 days No. 1", which is also a fixed income product. It started to collect on February 10 and ended on February 19. The risk level is level 2.

Among the two existing products, one is the Agricultural Bank of China "Agricultural Bank of China Xin Tong Lidong" 360-day technology innovation RMB financial product, which is a mixed investment nature, and the risk level is level 3.

The other continuing product is "Postbank Wealth Addition Hengjing Hengjin Shortest Holding Period 365 Day 1", which is a fixed income type. It started to collect funds on December 30 last year and officially operated on January 4 this year. The accumulated net value on February 8 was 1.0011.

According to the "Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension Funds", the financial products that the funds in the individual pension fund account can invest in include bank wealth management, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, and public funds.

The first batch of Individual Retirement Account financial products are on sale, which means that Individual Retirement Account investors can officially purchase financial products through Individual Retirement Account funds accounts.

Last November, the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission issued the Interim Measures for the Management of Individual Retirement Savings Account Business of Commercial Banks and Wealth Management Companies.

The Regulation stipulates that participants can purchase personal pension savings, personal pension financial products, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public fund products through their personal pension fund accounts.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance and the State Administration of Taxation issued a notice to clarify that the individual pension system will be implemented in 36 pilot cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, Shijiazhuang, Xiong’an New Area, Jincheng City, Shanxi Province, etc.

As of the end of 2022, the number of participants in the individual pension insurance program was 19.54 million, the number of contributors was 6.13 million, and the total contribution amount was RMB14.2 billion.
Previously, the banks participating in the pilot program only listed three types of products: individual pension savings, individual pension insurance products, and individual pension mutual funds.
Now that the personal pension fund financial products have been gathered, how should investors choose?

The expert of the Research and Development Department of Agricultural Bank of China Financial Products said that compared with other personal pension products, the pension financial products and personal pension financial products in the pilot stage have three characteristics.
Firstly, the stability, the risk management mechanism is more complete, the investment strategy and concept is more stable, and the non-mother bank third-party independent custody is implemented.

Secondly, the products have a long-term nature. The term of the pension financial products in the pilot phase is 5 years or more, and the next pension financial products to be issued will have a minimum holding period of 1 year, and it is encouraged to hold them for more than 3 years.
Thirdly, the products are more accessible, with low purchase thresholds. The starting point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan. The fees for the products are more favorable.
Professional people pointed out that investors should choose according to the characteristics of the product and their own risk tolerance.

The personal pension savings has the characteristics of long-term period, high interest rate and high safety, which is suitable for people with weak risk tolerance; the personal pension insurance product is mainly for guarantee, which is more suitable for people who cannot bear investment risk and can accept stable income; while the personal pension financial product and the public fund product do not guarantee the capital and the return, but have certain investment risk, and the expected return is high, which is suitable for people with certain financial knowledge and high
Written by reporter Cheng Jie, edited by Chai Hai
The fitness industry should get rid of the trust crisis-ChinaNews.com
Another large gym “blows up”?
Recently, the issue of the rights of members of the well-known fitness institution Zhongjian Fitness has attracted social attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not operating normally. Then, rumors about the collapse and running away of the institution caused panic among members, which led to the intervention of the public security and social security departments.

Finally, the relevant person in charge of the institution responded and promised to make every effort to protect the legitimate rights and interests of the employees and members, and the storm subsided.

Some branches of some fitness institutions have encountered problems in operation and are temporarily closed. Consumers can wait calmly for the problem to be solved. Why did many members’ first reaction to this be “something is wrong”?
Behind the storm of consumer rights protection in fitness clubs is a deep-rooted problem of trust crisis in the industry.
Traditional domestic gyms generally adopt the prepayment model, and "making money from users who don't come" is the bottom line of their development.

Through the pre-sale of membership cards to obtain cash flow, and continuously open new stores, it seems to be able to go round and round, but in fact it is eating the money of the future, and it is impossible to form a stable profit model.
The negative information about the gym running away frequently hit the consumer confidence.
From the perspective of market prospects, gyms can be considered a good business with a bright future.
Although the fitness industry has its ups and downs, it has always been a focus of capital attention.
Multiple data show that the popularity of cultural and sports consumption is on the rise, and the market is continuing to warm up.
As for the fitness market, with the steady improvement of residents' living standards and the deepening of the concept of healthy life, the fitness industry has great potential for development.
The better the situation is, the more the industry needs to pay attention to the quality of development.

However, some institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the consumption recovery. Just as they have just emerged from the crisis, they have blown the trumpet of expanding territory, and invested all the financing funds in the construction of new stores.

It is undeniable that in the past few years, many institutions have withdrawn from the industry due to the impact of the epidemic, and the industry has been reshuffled. At this time, enterprises with strong capabilities choose to increase their acquisition efforts and restructure their business, which may be a new opportunity.
However, in order to enter a virtuous circle and take a steady and far-reaching path, the industry must change its traditional model and change its business strategy.
Only by making solid progress and re-establishing the trust and security of consumers can we truly win the market and the future.
Compared with building new stores to seize the market, the fitness industry currently needs to calm down and optimize services, and use high-quality development to stabilize users.
First of all, it is necessary to retain users by service.
Gym belongs to the service industry. Its essence is to adhere to "user-oriented". It should focus on the user's needs and put the focus of operation on improving the quality of service.
Secondly, digital transformation can improve user experience.
For example, the Internet gym model that is popular at present allows users to pay per session and choose their own venue.
At the same time, the body data and sports data can be effectively utilized, and the social needs can be satisfied, realizing the complete service closed loop from online to offline.
Without the sales of personal trainers and without the huge annual membership fee, the users’ worries about the fitness institutions “running away” are reduced, and the trust is also improved.
In addition, we should actively explore diversified business models.

Nowadays, sports consumption has shifted from single service to scene consumption. Fitness clubs are expected to become new consumption entrances. Surrounding products such as sports nutrition and fitness equipment required for fitness may become new profit points, providing consumers with more choices.
Jiang Tianqiu

Nanjing real estate market reappears "price difference compensation" - chinanews.com

Yangtze Evening Post (reported by Ma Zuo Bo) - On the 10th, Yangtze Evening Post/Ziniu News reporter found during an interview that after more than ten years, the "price guarantee agreement" has returned to the Nanjing real estate market. A residential complex in the Jiangbei New District claims to "compensate the difference in price", and before the handover, the benefits of other properties are greater than the previous discounts.
“保价协议”的条件可不少
This property is called Poly International Jiangbei Xiyun Tower. Mr. Sun, a potential buyer, told the reporter that he found a "notice" while looking at the property last weekend.

The picture sent by him to the reporter shows that the developer of the project promised that any buyers who purchased the property between February 1 and February 28 would be entitled to a refund of the difference in price if the other properties in the project offered a better discount than the one they had originally purchased (limited to other unsold properties of the same type, same building, same unit, and same property type).

Mr. Sun said that the property consultant said that this was actually a "price guarantee agreement", which was intended to make buyers feel at ease to make a purchase, without worrying about the developer lowering the price to promote sales, "Now I'm afraid that it will be lowered after I buy it, and I don't have time to go to the sales office to make a fuss, and I'm really upset if I don't make a fuss".
不少购房者则认为,“保价协议”虽然给了购房者“定心丸”,但是条件却并不低。
打算在江北買一套刚需房的郑女士说,保价的房源首先是要同一户型,还得在同一楼栋、同一个单元,买家可以比价的房源寥寥,因此“门槛”还是蛮高的。

Some buyers also believe that due to the information asymmetry, the seller may not exclude the possibility of giving additional concessions during the sales, and it is not easy for the buyer to "maintain rights".
Whether to keep the buyers remains to be seen

The reporter learned from the Nanjing Property Network that the project obtained the sales permit for 252 units in two buildings in November last year. The types of the units include 105 square meters, 114 square meters, 129 square meters, etc. The average price of the fully decorated units is RMB 39,843 per square meter.

However, two months later, the online real estate shows that the total number of unsold units in the project is 157, accounting for 62.3%, of which 128 units in Building 8 are unsold, and 44 units in Building 7 are unsold, and the total number of units sold is only 33, accounting for 13%.
Market insiders said that the "price guarantee agreement" had also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, the Huangshan Road project in the Xiyuan area of Xiangtang in the Western Hills area attracted buyers’ attention by introducing the “Price Guarantee Plan”. The specific content was “the company solemnly promised that if the project’s discount increased within one year, the company would refund the difference to the old owners”.
2011年4月,南京也有9家楼盘拿出部分房源承诺“差價賠付”。
“The real estate market is warming up, and it needs a ‘heart stimulant’ at this time.
“The ‘price guarantee’ is also one of the marketing methods of real estate enterprises,” said Mr. Shen, a senior trader in the real estate industry in Nanjing.
He believes that today's developers need more confidence than buyers, and the "price guarantee agreement" is actually a way to boost their morale.
As for whether the buyers can be retained, he said that it depends on the influence of multiple factors such as the macro-control policy and the loan threshold. At present, it is still to be seen.
Several data declined; Taiwan economy started the year poorly - chinanews.com

Xinhua News Agency, Taipei, February 11 (reported by Zhao Bo and Huang Yang) -- The export trade volume "five consecutive black" and the manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) contracted for seven consecutive months, and the consumer price index (CPI) saw "three-digit" again... Recently, the Taiwan authorities have successively released the economic data of January 2023.
Experts believe that the Taiwan economy has not performed well at the beginning of the year, and the pressure to grow is not small.

According to the financial affairs department of the Taiwan government, the export of Taiwan region in January this year was US$31.51 billion, down 21.2% year-on-year, and the negative growth continued for the fifth consecutive month.
The export volume of 11 major export goods categories all declined compared with the same period last year.
The plastic and rubber products and optical equipment have the deepest decline, with a year-on-year decrease of 37.6% and 35.7%, respectively.
The export of electronic components and parts fell by 20.1% year-on-year, the largest decline in 11 years.
Among them, the integrated circuit fell by 18.3%, the largest decline in 14 years.

The head of the statistics department of the Ministry of Finance, Cai Meina, said that this shows that the weak demand of the consumer electronics industry has spread, and the electronics industry has entered a correction period.
Statistics show that in January, the import and export of Taiwan region both declined, and the surplus amount was only 2.34 billion U.S. dollars, which was the lowest level in the past three years.

The Ministry of Finance of the Taiwan government believes that the global terminal demand has decreased, and the industry adjustment of inventory has suppressed the manufacturer’s intention to purchase materials. The export slump is unlikely to improve in the short term, and the export recession in Taiwan in the first quarter of this year is likely to be higher than expected.

According to the Taiwan Chung-Hua Institute for Economic Research, the Taiwan Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for January this year, after seasonal adjustment, was 40.4%, down 3.3 percentage points from the previous month in December last year, and has contracted for seven consecutive months.
In the economic monitoring index system, PMI is the line of prosperity and recession, and the index greater than 50% represents the expansion of prosperity, and vice versa.
In the five components of Taiwan PMI in January, new orders, production and human resource hiring contracted, supplier delivery time declined, and inventory contracted.

All six major industries reported a contraction in PMI, with the order of contraction speed being the power and machinery industry (35.1%), the electronics and optical industry (35.2%), the chemical and biotechnology and medical industry (39.2%), the basic raw materials industry (42.4%), the transportation industry (42.6%) and the food and textile industry (45.7%).

In terms of prices, the Taiwan government's "Ministry of Finance" announced that the year-on-year increase rate of Taiwan's CPI in January was 3.04%, which once again broke through 3% since July last year.
Among them, the price of vegetables soared by 28.25%, creating a new high in 17 months.

Taiwan's Bureau of Statistics and Accounting's special committee member Cao Zhiming frankly said that the increase in vegetable prices was indeed beyond expectations. Excluding the factors of Spring Festival, the average CPI in January and February this year should be close to 2.71% of last December, and the inflationary pressure still exists and is still at a high level.
Looking ahead to Taiwan's economy this year, according to reports from domestic media such as the United Daily News and Yahoo Finance, experts are pessimistic.
台湾“中央大学”经济系教授吴大任分析,出口衰退可能造成出口制造业厂商现金流出现问题,债务违约风险上升。
At the same time, the reduction of orders leads to the reduction of human resource cost of manufacturers, which affects the labor market and family economy, and then affects the consumption ability.

Taiwan Institute of Economic Research researcher Qiu Dasheng believes that the inflation situation in Europe and the United States has not been resolved this year, and demand continues to shrink. He estimates that the decline in Taiwan's exports will continue into the first half of the year.
Since Taiwan's economy is supported by exports, the economic growth for the whole year will be worse than last year due to the low export.

Report: Number of overseas students returning to China for job hunting hits new high in 2022 - chinanews.com
Top 10 countries for studying abroad for graduating students returning to China for employment in 2022 Source: “2022 China Returnee Employment Survey Report”

China News Service, Beijing, February 11 (Meng Rui) The recently released “2022 China Overseas Returnees Employment Survey Report” (hereinafter referred to as “the report”) shows that the scale of graduating overseas students in 2022 increased by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of overseas students returning to China to seek employment reached a new high, and the demand of Chinese enterprises for overseas talents also showed an upward trend.<
The report pointed out that since 2020, the number of overseas Chinese who seek jobs in China has increased significantly, and the number of overseas students who seek jobs in China has increased.
Compared with 2021, the scale of graduating overseas students increased by 8.6% in 2022, and the number of overseas students seeking employment in China reached a new high.

From the distribution of the countries where the overseas students study, the United Kingdom has the highest proportion, accounting for 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the United States (9%), ranking the same as that in 2021.
In terms of year-on-year growth, the number of graduates from Malaysia, Japan and Singapore increased significantly, with growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9% and 37.7%, respectively.
The number of graduates studying abroad from Canada, Germany, the United States and Australia decreased year-on-year.
Trend of supply and demand of overseas talents after the Spring Festival in 2023 – Source: “2022 China Overseas Talent Employment Survey Report”

According to the survey, among the overseas students who decided to return to China, 58% thought that "life in China is more convenient", 40% decided to return to China because they "more identified with the cultural environment in China", 32% thought that "there are more job opportunities in China", and 22% thought that the economic activities in China would recover faster, and they could get more job opportunities.
Data shows that the demand for overseas talents by domestic enterprises is rapidly released, and the demand for talents returning from abroad is on the rise.

In the first week after the Spring Festival in 2023, the number of positions that prioritized overseas returnees and the number of overseas returnees seeking jobs in China both showed an upward trend. The number of positions that prioritized overseas returnees on February 3 increased by 11% compared with January 28, and the number of overseas returnees seeking jobs increased by 27%.

In terms of industry, in the 2022 returnee-preferred positions, the positions in the education/training industry accounted for 27.8%, ranking first, while the positions in the professional services/consulting industry and the Internet/e-commerce industry ranked second and third, accounting for 14.3% and 11.1%, respectively.
Changes in the number of overseas Chinese people seeking employment in China in recent years. Source: "2022 China Overseas Chinese Employment Survey Report"

From the perspective of salary, the average recruitment salary of overseas returnees’ preferred positions has risen for three consecutive years. In 2022, it reached 1,468 yuan/month (RMB, the same below), an increase of 961 yuan from 13,719 yuan/month in 2021, an increase of 7%.

From the perspective of regions, the willingness of the overseas returnees to develop in the new first-tier cities, second-tier cities and third-tier and below cities has increased in 2022. The proportion of applications in 2022 was 31%, 15.7% and 14.3%, which were all higher than the proportion of applications in 2021.
As for the gains of studying abroad, 52.7% of the returnees said that they were basically in line with their expectations, up 2.8 percentage points from the previous year (49.9%).
Among the returnees, 28.2% said that their expectations were exceeded or far exceeded, a proportion higher than that of 2021 (25.4%).
(End)

Henan regulates and integrates the prices of dental implant medical services - chinanews.com
CCTV.com news: dental implants are an ideal choice for many patients with missing teeth, but the price of each implant, which is often over RMB10,000, has always been a deterrent for many patients.
This year, with the accelerated implementation of the collective procurement of dental implants, various regions have also put the reduction of dental implant prices on the agenda.

From February 10, the full process price control target for a single regular dental implant medical service in Henan Province is 4300 yuan, and the full process cost of a single regular dental implant does not exceed 97% of the price control target.

Dental implants are a type of dental restoration that uses the lower structure implanted in the bone as a foundation to support and fix the upper dental restoration body for the restoration of missing teeth.
The reporter learned from the First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University that the price of a single regular implant is about RMB16,000 from implantation to the final restoration.
Patient He Ying: After the new policy, the doctor told me that my situation would cost me about 8,000 yuan, less than 10,000 yuan, which is about half the price.

On the basis of the existing items, Henan Province has also integrated and determined 15 medical service price items for oral implantation, and unified the price and medical insurance payment categories of provincial public medical institutions, and canceled or adjusted 20 medical service price items, such as dental implantation.

Li Yunjie, Director of the Pharmaceutical Pricing and Tendering Department of Zhengzhou Medical Security Bureau: The beneficiaries are mainly four parties. One is the medical insurance, which will reduce its expenditure; the hospital's pressure will be reduced, and the patients will increase appropriately; the suppliers will get a market; and for our patients, they are the biggest beneficiaries. The cost of planting a tooth may be reduced by half or even more.
Shenzhen: Build a world-leading ultra-fast city in China - chinanews.com

ChinaNews.com, February 11, 2021: According to the news released by the WeChat public account of Shenzhen Industry and Information Technology on February 10, the Shenzhen Municipal Bureau of Industry and Information Technology recently issued the Shenzhen Action Plan for Building a Super Smart City.

Among them, it is proposed that by the end of 2023, a super-wideband network with high speed, large capacity and low latency will be built, and the goal of "double gigabit, all optical network, 1 millisecond, and the Internet of Things" network construction will be achieved, and a super-fast city will be built to be the first in China and the world.
The plan proposes to accelerate the upgrading of gigabit optical fiber network.
By the end of 2023, the proportion of 10G PON ports will reach 100%, and the number of all-optical industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires that the energy efficiency of 5G networks be comprehensively improved.
Research and formulate the quality standards of 5G network services in Shenzhen, conduct 5G network testing and evaluation, and improve the quality of 5G network services.

Support the basic telecommunications enterprises to increase the optimization of 5G networks in key areas and venues, and add 10,000 5G base stations in the whole year. The average download speed in the whole city is 500 Mbps, and the average upload speed is 100 Mbps. The download speed in the key areas is 1000 Mbps, and the upload speed is 200 Mbps. The network speed and user experience are greatly improved.
Build a city-level high-quality wireless local area network.

Formulate the service standards of public place wireless local area network (WLAN), and promote the upgrading of WLAN in densely populated and information consumption demand concentrated areas in all districts of the city, providing gigabit access capability.

We will build a unified authentication and supervision platform for the city’s public wireless local area network based on “Shenzhen i-network”, so as to achieve “one-time authentication, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching”, and support the operator to include the social self-built AP (wireless access point) with public service capability in the authentication and supervision platform.
By the end of 2023, the total number of access points will be upgraded to at least 20,000.

In addition, the plan also proposes to build a high-quality all-optical network, construct a multi-level computing power supply system, accelerate the construction of key communication network facilities, and improve the Internet application service capability.
The plan clearly states that it will collaborate to build the Internet of Things perception system.

Exploring the construction and management model of urban perception terminals based on the open source HONGMENG operating system, reducing the cost of integration, accelerating the construction of urban IoT perception platforms, and promoting the interconnection and intercommunication of networks and data of urban IoT platforms and professional IoT platforms in various fields.

Deepen the application of the Internet of Things and perception in the fields of urban management, public services, public security, traffic and travel, and expand the channels of fixed perception and intelligent connected vehicles and mobile perception.

By the end of 2023, the number of water, electricity, gas and things Internet of Things perception terminals will exceed 9 million, and 20 multi-functional smart lamppost application demonstration projects will be built.

The plan also mentions that it will strengthen the integration of satellite and ground communications, lay out the construction of low-altitude network infrastructure, and promote the deep coverage of 5G networks at sea.
At the same time, it will promote the deep coverage of 5G network at sea, build an ecosystem for industrial innovation and development, and support the hosting of top-level competitions and events.
(China News Service Finance and Economics)
China’s e-commerce industry is experiencing “new variables”. How can it achieve “content is king”?
Chinanews is an important news website in China.
China News Service, February 11: Title: China’s e-commerce industry is surging with “new variables”. How to make “content is king”?
China News Service Financial Journalist Xia Bin
“我们入局电商算是晚的,但从一开始就意识到,想要从千千万万的店铺中脱颖而出,内容很重要。
“We entered the e-commerce industry late, but we realized from the beginning that content is important if we want to stand out from the millions of stores.”
Imitating the film tone of old Hong Kong films and accompanied by classic Cantonese songs, open @ Fangfang's one-person food account on TikTok, and the exquisite videos are refreshing.

At the recent TikTok e-commerce "Find Fellow Travelers and Share Quality Content" event, Fangfang, as a representative of quality content creators, spoke on the stage and introduced her experiences and insights in daily creation.

She said at the scene, "The carefully polished videos have attracted a lot of netizens' attention. Many people are interested in the ingredients in my family and want to make delicious food with them. The sales have opened up at once.
Fangfang’s cooking videos have made more people fall in love with “Guangdong cuisine”. A live broadcast can sell up to 300,000 sets of health food, saving her family’s old store from bankruptcy.
“No content, no e-commerce”, as short videos and live e-commerce continue to develop, people’s requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early stage of live streaming e-commerce, the live streaming room often attracts users with low prices and discounts. It seems that price advantage was the only selling point at that time.

In recent years, there are not only the phenomenon-level big V such as Liu Geng Hong and Dongfang Zhen Xuan, but also many unknown talents and merchants in the vertical niche market. They improve their long-term business benefits by continuously creating high-quality content that meets their brand’s personality.

Gao Xiaoxuan, the manager of the operation of the e-commerce star creators on Douyin, said that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have turned their content into real money through Douyin e-commerce, and their content creation volume has increased by 252%, and their total sales volume has doubled.
“Behind these figures, we can feel the vigorous growth and vitality of the author ecosystem.
Gao Yaxuan said.

Beijing Normal University’s Communication Innovation and Future Media Experimental Platform previously released the “E-Commerce Industry Content Ecosystem Health Index (ECHI) Report”, which analyzes the importance of quality content in the current e-commerce industry from a data perspective, and uses the index to assess the content ecosystem of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the ranking of the e-commerce industry content ecological health index in the above report, Tik Tok e-commerce, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com ranked the top five.

The report believes that the content ecosystem of e-commerce is a comprehensive concept, which integrates e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. Only good PGC (professional produced content) and UGC (user-generated content) can be integrated with e-commerce. The higher the value of content platforms, the richer the consumption and promotion scenarios, the higher the possibility of e-commerce implantation, and the stronger the commercial value. The proportion of e-commerce content production and

At the scene, Yu Guoming, professor of the School of Journalism and Communication of Beijing Normal University and chairman of the China Media Economy and Management Professional Committee, analyzed and interpreted the report.

He said that in terms of content value, the e-commerce industry has now transitioned from the "accessibility of consumption" to the "quality of consumption" stage, and high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the "hard currency" of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the fundamental and driving force of e-commerce development in the new stage, and PGC content such as knowledge payment, professional knowledge, and KOL (key opinion leader) has become a standard in e-commerce live broadcast.
Looking to the future of the e-commerce industry, Yu Guoming made two suggestions.

One is from the perspective of improving the content structure, promoting the overall improvement of the health and quality of the e-commerce content ecosystem, creating positive content creation and management standards, and achieving the dynamic balance of the e-commerce industry content ecosystem health index.

Another is from the perspective of external ecology. It is necessary to realize the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value co-creation and co-creation of the external environment.

"In the future, the e-commerce industry will need more support from data and artificial intelligence to form a prediction of stability for future development; in addition, it will provide more standardized and healthy growth space for merchants, and realize the value co-creation of enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry, and create a healthy content ecosystem.
