Beijing Stock Exchange to launch margin trading business next week - chinanews.com

This newspaper reported (correspondent Sun Jie) last night that the Beijing Stock Exchange announced that, after approval by the China Securities Regulatory Commission, the margin trading business of the Beijing Stock Exchange will be officially launched on February 13. At that time, the securities companies that have obtained the margin trading rights of the Beijing Stock Exchange can accept the delegation of investors and apply for margin trading to the Beijing Stock Exchange.
The list of the first batch of securities for margin trading was determined on January 31, 2023.

The list of stocks for margin trading and the list of securities that can be used as collateral will be published in the "Information Disclosure - Margin Trading Information" section of the official website of the North Exchange to facilitate investors' inquiries.
Margin trading is an important basic system in the securities market, and is also a relatively mature trading method in the international securities market.
On September 2 last year, on the occasion of the one-year anniversary, the North Exchange publicly solicited opinions on margin trading.

The launch of the North Exchange margin trading is an important measure to continuously promote the construction of the North Exchange market system, improve the trading mechanism, and enhance the pricing function of the secondary market.
The margin trading system is beneficial to enriching investors' trading strategies, meeting investors' diverse trading needs, promoting price discovery, and further improving market liquidity.

Next, the North Exchange will continue to do a good job in all aspects of the financing and securities business under the leadership of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, and will enrich the trading system tools with the needs of investors as the guide, improve the relevant supporting mechanisms, and focus on building a first-class exchange to serve innovative small and medium-sized enterprises.
The 16th China-Japan Energy Conservation and Environmental Protection Comprehensive Forum was held in Beijing. He Lifeng attended the main forum and delivered a keynote speech-China News Network
Xinhua News Agency, Beijing, February 11 - The 16th China-Japan Energy Conservation and Environmental Protection Forum was held in Beijing on February 11 in a combined online and offline manner.
He Lifeng, member of the CPC Central Committee and head of the National Development and Reform Commission, attended the main forum and gave the keynote speech.

He Lifeng pointed out that holding this forum is an important measure to implement the consensus reached by President Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Kishida Fumio at the Bangkok meeting and strengthen the cooperation in green development between China and Japan.

China will comprehensively implement the spirit of the 20th CPC National Congress, accelerate the green transformation of development mode, deepen the prevention and control of environmental pollution, comprehensively strengthen resource conservation, and actively and prudently promote carbon peaking and carbon neutrality. It will also promote the reduction of carbon emissions, pollution reduction, green expansion and economic growth, and promote ecological priority, intensive use, green and low-carbon development.

China is willing to work with Japan to continue to deepen cooperation in green and low-carbon industries, technology, policy dialogue and people-to-people exchanges, and to promote the green development cooperation between the two countries to new heights.
Yasutoshi Nishimura, Minister of Economy, Trade and Industry of Japan, attended the main forum and delivered a keynote speech.

The forum was jointly hosted by the National Development and Reform Commission of China, the Ministry of Commerce, the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry of Japan, and the Japan-China Economic Association. It included the main forum and four sub-forums on energy efficiency improvement, vehicle electrification and intelligence, hydrogen energy, and long-term trade between China and Japan.
Representatives from the governments, enterprises and institutions of China and Japan exchanged views.
China’s rescue team continues to carry out rescue operations in Turkey. 4 people have been rescued so far-China News

China News Service, February 11 - According to the message on the website of the Ministry of Emergency Management on February 11, on February 10, the Chinese rescue team in Turkey dispatched 3 action teams and 45 rescue team members to rescue one trapped person.
At the same time, two search and evaluation teams were dispatched to evaluate and inspect the 15 buildings on Vodabas Street.
As of now, a total of 4 people have been rescued, 5 people have been found dead, and 25 buildings with serious collapses have been assessed for signs of life and risk.
The rescue team will adjust the rescue force according to the actual situation of the disaster area and the situation of the rescue site, and continue to carry out the rescue work in a deepening way.

The rescue team obtained the information of rescue and help through multiple channels such as embassy, local government and United Nations rescue organization, and verified them one by one through online inquiry and on-site search.
The Hong Kong Search and Rescue Team was introduced to the current rescue environment and the situation of building collapse, and the two teams jointly conducted search operations.

Currently, the Chinese team is jointly responsible for the regional coordination (SSC5) with the Italian rescue team. At the same time, three members of the team are participating in the work of the rescue coordination center of the 5th area, communicating with the Italian, British, Serbian, Slovakian, Omani and other teams, and understanding the rescue work of the United Nations rescue organization and the rescue teams of various countries.

The rescue team continued to strengthen safety management and team support. According to the principle of "unified command and safety first", the safety management of the rescue site was strengthened, the requirements of the rescue work discipline were strengthened, and the safety attention items were clarified.
Continuously run the duty and post system, and strengthen the safety management of the camp.

The medical staff of the rescue team provides daily health check for the team members, strengthens the medical care for the key personnel, and the whole team is in good health. The disinfection of the camp is carried out.

Since the establishment of the camp, the logistic support team has built 26 tents for command and communication, equipment storage, medical disinfection, living and accommodation, and kennels, and provided more than 30 sets of equipment for the rescue site.

(Deutsche Welle Chinese) On Friday, February 10, the Biden administration blacklisted six Chinese entities suspected of participating in the espionage balloon program.

The US Department of Commerce said that these five Chinese companies and one research institute helped the Chinese military to modernize, especially in aerospace projects, including airships and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist will find it difficult to obtain US technology exports.

The list is called the "entity list", and companies on the list will not be able to purchase technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they obtain a special export license from the U.S. Department of Commerce.

The companies listed on the blacklist are: Beijing Nanjiang Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd., the 48th Research Institute of China Electronics Technology Group, Dongguan Lingkong Sensing Technology Co., Ltd., the Eagle Gate Aerospace Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Eagle Gate Aerospace Technology Group Co., Ltd.

Prior to this, the White House said it was considering making broader measures to "expose and deal with" China's larger-scale surveillance activities that threaten the national security of the United States.
The balloon incident has caused further tension between China and the United States, and US Secretary of State Blinken has cancelled his visit to China.

On February 4, the United States shot down the balloon. The Chinese government lodged a solemn protest with the US embassy in China, criticizing the United States for seriously undermining and damaging the efforts and progress of both sides to stabilize the Sino-US relations.

From the existing wreckage evidence and the information of the procurement platform of the Chinese military, the US government drew the conclusion that the manufacturer of the balloon "has a direct relationship with the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and is a supplier approved by the Chinese military.

Mao Ning, spokesperson of the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, said at a press conference on Friday that regarding the incident of a Chinese civilian balloon mistakenly entering the US airspace due to force majeure, the Chinese side has explained the situation and clarified its position many times.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the relevant resolution of the US Congress was purely a political manipulation and hype.
China is firmly opposed to and strongly dissatisfied with that.

Matthew Axelrod, Assistant Secretary of the Department of Commerce in charge of export enforcement, said: "Today's action shows that we have made joint efforts to identify and stop China's use of espionage balloons that violate the airspace of the United States and more than 40 countries.
Reuters reported that an employee of Shenzhen Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd. said he was not aware of the sanctions and declined to comment further.
The Chinese embassy in the United States and the Chinese embassy in Washington have not yet commented on this information.
(Reuters and others)

(Deutsche Welle Chinese) Several days after the earthquake hit some parts of Turkey and Syria, the hope of finding survivors is fading, but the rescue team was relieved to find a family of five who were rescued on Saturday.
The family of five was rescued from the rubble in Nurdagi, a hard-hit town in Gaziantep province, after being trapped for more than five days, the Associated Press reported.
Rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from a pile of rubble, then found the father, who insisted on saving his son and another daughter first.
When they were all rescued, the crowd cheered.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were also rescued in the harsh winter weather.
I forgot what day it is today.
"How long have I been here?" - the 16-year-old boy asked the rescuers who pulled him from the rubble after being trapped for 129 hours.
A man from Kahramanmaras holds his cat after it was rescued
Miraculous rescues have given a glimmer of hope to the search and rescue operation, which had been all but given up, but the death toll continues to rise.
Official figures put the death toll from Monday's earthquake in Turkey at more than 20,000, with more than 3,500 people estimated to have died in neighbouring Syria.
Despite experts saying that people can survive up to a week trapped in rubble, the chances of finding more survivors are becoming increasingly slim.
Rescuers are still using thermal imaging to search for signs of life under the rubble.
Meanwhile, the focus of the rescue effort has shifted to helping the survivors who are most in need.
UN official: 'Century in a century' disaster in Turkey

Martin Griffiths, the UN's under-secretary general for humanitarian affairs and emergency relief coordinator, said at a news conference in Turkey that the earthquake was "the worst disaster in the region in a century."
She also commended the country for their "extraordinary" response to the disaster.
He also told Reuters that he hoped to be able to provide aid to areas controlled by the Syrian government and opposition, but said the details were "not clear."
The United Nations has pledged an additional $25 million in aid to people affected by the earthquake in Syria.
Earlier this week, the United Nations had already announced a $25 million donation to Turkey and Syria for relief efforts.
The 60 most destructive earthquakes in the world in the last 60 years
Chile , Pacific Rim
At 3:11 pm local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever recorded by humans occurred in Valdivia, Chile, with a seismic moment magnitude of 9.5.
In less than ten minutes, the whole city of Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
The tremor caused localised tsunamis that severely battered the Chilean coast, with waves up to 25 metres (82 ft).
Waves as high as 10.7 metres (35 ft) were recorded 10,000 kilometres (6,200 mi) from the epicenter, and as far away as Japan and the Philippines.
The death toll and monetary losses arising from this widespread disaster are not certain.
The most destructive earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
Alaska's Good Friday earthquake
March 27, 1964 was a Friday, and Good Friday.
On this day, the largest earthquake in the history of North America occurred in Alaska, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Great Alaska Earthquake remained the third largest earthquake on record.
When the earthquake occurred, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate broke near the College Fjord in Prince William Sound.
The earthquake lasted for three to five minutes in most areas.
The displacement of the seabed triggered a massive tsunami, with a height of 67 metres.
Because it was a holiday, schools and many businesses were closed.
The earthquake ultimately claimed 139 lives.
Of the 139 deaths, nine were directly caused by the earthquake and the other 130 were caused by the tsunami.
60年にわたる世界最大の破壊力の地震
Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two strong earthquakes with a magnitude of 7 or more occurred in Tangshan and Fengnan counties of Hebei Province in 16 hours.
The epicenter was 23 kilometers from the ground.
The whole city of Tangshan was cut off from traffic, communication, water supply and power supply, and was destroyed in an instant.
The capital Beijing, 140 kilometers away, also felt the strong tremors.
According to official statistics, including Beijing and Tianjin, all the disaster-stricken areas, the earthquake caused 242769 deaths and 164851 serious injuries.
The Tangshan earthquake became the second deadliest earthquake in China's recorded history, second only to the 1556 Shaanxi earthquake.
However, some foreign scientists estimated that this earthquake may have caused at least 650,000 deaths.
The most destructive earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
2004 Indian Ocean Earthquake

On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred in the west of Aceh Province, Sumatra Island, Indonesia, 160 kilometers away from the epicenter, with a depth of 30 kilometers and a moment magnitude of 9.1-9.3.
The earthquake triggered a substantial tsunami with wave height of 15 to 30 meters.

A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected by the tsunami. The most severely affected areas included Aceh province in Indonesia, Koh Lanta and Phuket holiday resorts in Thailand, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu in India.

It was the peak tourist season of Christmas, and the disaster area was crowded with tourists and local residents, which caused many tourists enjoying their holiday on the beach and local people working by the sea to be swept away by the tsunami and buried under the sea, making many people missing in this earthquake.
It is estimated that the number of casualties and missing persons is at least 300,000.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Sichuan earthquake, 2008
On 12 May 2008, a gigantic earthquake took place in Wenchuan, in China ' s Sichuan Province.

According to the data of China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave magnitude of this earthquake reached 8.2 and the moment magnitude reached 8.3. The area of destruction exceeded 100,000 square kilometers.

As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake caused 69227 deaths, 17923 missing, 374643 injuries of different degrees, 1,993.03 million people lost their homes, and the total population affected by the disaster was 4625.6 million.
It is the most destructive earthquake in the history of the People's Republic of China, and also the most serious casualties after the earthquake in Tangshan.

On March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 of each year would be designated as National Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day to strengthen the education of the public and the attention to disaster prevention and reduction work.
Since then, governments and primary and middle schools in many parts of China have held earthquake drills on this day every year.
Primary and secondary schools also began to pay attention to the popularization of "earthquake disaster prevention and mitigation" education.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, a 7.0-magnitude earthquake hit the Caribbean island nation of Haiti.
The epicenter was located 25 kilometers south of the capital Port-au-Prince, and the epicenter was about 13 kilometers deep.
The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies estimated that as many as 3 million people had been affected by the quake.
The Haitian government has confirmed more than 200,000 deaths.
Almost 90% of houses in this village were destroyed by the earthquake.
Although the international community provided a lot of aid and support, this overpopulated, corrupt and impoverished country has never recovered from this disaster.
The 60 most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Category: 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami
On March 11, 2011, a large megathrust earthquake with a moment magnitude of 9.0 occurred off the coast of northeastern Japan.

The epicenter was located in the Pacific Ocean east of Sendai, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, and the depth of the earthquake focus was measured at 24 km. It triggered a huge tsunami with a maximum wave height of 40.1 m.
It was the first earthquake in Japan with a magnitude of more than 9.
Approximately 22,000 people died in the disaster, and about 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami and suffered a leakage accident.
This accident was classified as the most serious level 7 on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear accident caused the detection of minute radioactive substances in the whole world, including iodine-131 and caesium-137 (half-life of 30 years).
A large amount of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean as a result of this nuclear accident.
According to the United Nations, at least 870,000 people in Syria and Turkey are in urgent need of food.
In Syria alone, as many as 5.3 million people have been displaced by the earthquake.
The World Food Program called for a $77 million donation to provide food for the victims of the earthquake in Turkey and Syria.
The temperature in the disaster-stricken areas is as low as zero, and many victims have no shelter.
The Turkish government has distributed a large amount of hot meals, tents and blankets, but these supplies are still difficult to reach many people in need of help.
In Syria, which has been mired in a 12-year civil war, the earthquake has made the situation worse.
In the four days since the earthquake, WFP has already provided food assistance to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for treating injuries and emergency surgeries.
(Associated Press, Reuters, etc.)

Google AI chatbot "answers wrong questions"; parent company's stock value evaporates $10 billion
(Combined report on November 11)

Google's new AI chatbot Bard has had a rocky start, with a promotional video showing it answering questions incorrectly, causing the stock price of its parent company Alphabet to fall by 8.9% on Thursday, breaking through the $100 mark, and wiping out $110 billion in market value (RM47.65 billion), closing at $94.57 on Friday.
The market is worried that Alphabet is not as good as its competitor Microsoft.

According to the report of Reuters, Google earlier published a promotional video of AI chatbot Bard on social media. In the video, someone asked Bard: "What new discoveries about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) can I tell my 9-year-old child?
Bard mentioned in the answer that the telescope had taken the first picture of an exoplanet.

However, according to the data of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the first photo of the exoplanet was taken by the "Extremely Large Telescope" of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters reported the news with the headline "Alphabet's stock price plunged after Bard gave an incorrect answer".

On the other hand, Google pointed out that Bard's response "highlights the importance of rigorous testing process", which will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's response "meets high standards in terms of quality, safety and real information".
Singapore’s tourism industry rebounds strongly, with inbound tourists up 19 times from 2021

(Singapore, November 11) The Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that it is expected that the number of international visitors to Singapore in 2023 will reach 12 million to 14 million, which will bring about tourism revenue of about S$18 billion to S$21 billion; the number of visitors and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of the pre-COVID-19 level in 2019; and there is a high possibility that the tourism industry
Singapore's tourism market gradually re-started and recovered in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board show that the number of inbound tourists increased by 19 times from 330,600 in 2021 to 6.3 million in 2022, exceeding the earlier estimate of 4 million to 6 million by the Tourism Board. The number of tourists has recovered to 33% of the pre-epidemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore’s tourism revenue totaled 8.96 billion Singapore dollars, and it is estimated that the tourism revenue in 2022 will reach 13.8 billion to 14.3 billion Singapore dollars, which is 6 to 7 times that of 2021 (1.89 billion Singapore dollars), and has recovered to about 50% to 52% of the level before the COVID-19 pandemic in 2019.<|im
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced that it would allocate nearly S$500 million to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.

The Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that it plans to allocate S$110 million from this budget over the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists to return.

In order to make health and wellness one of the highlights of tourism in Singapore, the Singapore Tourism Board launched an intention collection activity on November 23, 2022, planning to develop a health and wellness attraction on the southern coast of Singapore.

Saying that in recent years, more and more tourists have put their physical health as the top consideration factor, Wang Lingli, the Executive Director of the Sports and Wellness Tourism Division of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that the Singapore Tourism Board has launched a tender to develop a wellness destination in the southern coast of Singapore.

Developing a health and wellness destination in Marina South, which is home to Gardens by the Bay and Marina Barrage, is expected to contribute to Singapore’s tourism and economy, and encourage tourists to spend more and stay longer in Singapore.
Singapore Tourism Board Chairman Chen Jianlong said that in the next few years, health and wellness will become an important part of Singapore's tourism products.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Board has been promoting health and wellness programs to both local residents and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Wellness Festival, offering more than 130 wellness activities and experiences to the public.
Singapore will continue to provide new travel experiences for tourists.

In addition to the newly opened Children’s Museum of Singapore, the Avatar World at Gardens by the Bay, the Central Beach Market at Sentosa, the new “Explore New Frontiers” gallery at the ArtScience Museum, and the open-air theater at Night Safari, the Ministry of Trade and Industry will support the development and renewal of projects such as the Jurong Bird Park in the Wild Wild World, making Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will formulate the industry standards for the sustainable development of the meetings, conventions, exhibitions and incentive travel industry by the end of 2023, and focus on improving the waste disposal and carbon emissions, further optimizing the tourism environment.
Singapore’s tourism industry is recovering faster, which is accelerating the recovery of the aviation industry.

Data shows that as of December 18, 2022, the passenger traffic at Changi Airport has recovered strongly, with the number of passengers reaching 150,000 per day and 1 million per week, which is equivalent to 75% of the pre-pandemic level. The number of aviation employees on duty has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-pandemic level.

According to the statistics, Singapore has received 23.6 million tourists from January to October 2022, which is equivalent to 42% of the pre-epidemic period. The number of take-off and landing flights is 170,000, which is 53% of the pre-epidemic period.
The rapid recovery of the tourism industry has also driven the recovery of the hospitality, transportation, catering and retail industries.
The Singapore government and tourism industry have high expectations for the Chinese market.

Koh Shu Dan, Assistant Director of the International Department of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that a survey by a Chinese travel platform showed that Singapore ranked third in the world in terms of safety, which is also one of the reasons why Singapore is so popular with Chinese tourists.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, China sent about 3.6 million tourists to Singapore each year.
With China easing its border policy, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists will recover to 30% to 60% of that in 2019 this year.

Koh Shu Dan pointed out that in the future, the Tourism Board will pay close attention to the signals of further release of outbound travel policies by China, in order to cope with the changes in tourist demand.

In addition to strengthening partnership with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies such as Ctrip, the Singapore Tourism Board will also actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists to Singapore by taking into account the new trends of Chinese outbound tourism.

Looking ahead to the tourism market in 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is confident that the tourism industry will recover faster than expected as long as the global economy does not experience a significant recession that affects public income, and there are no new large-scale outbreaks of deadly diseases.
Kim Jong-un and his daughter interacted closely, while his wife was left out

(Combined Report on the 11th) North Korea held a military parade on the evening of August 8 to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the founding of the military. Kim Jong-un's daughter Kim Ju-ae not only attended the event, but also stood on the podium with her father.

On the 9th, the North Korean official media released a film, in which Kim Ju-ae leaned on her father, and looked at each other with affection and whispered to each other. She gently held her father's face with her hands, and even touched her father's chest. The father and daughter's mutual painting was broadcast to the whole country.
However, First Lady Ri Sol-ju could only retreat to the side.

According to reports from Korean "Chosun News" and other media, Kim Jong-un and Ri Sol-ju attended a banquet with their daughter Kim Ju-ae on the 7th. In the official group photo of the banquet, Kim Ju-ae sat in the middle of her parents, which was rare. On the evening of the 75th anniversary of the military parade on the 8th, she also stood on the podium with Kim Jong-un.
After the military parade, the North Korean official media "Korean Central Television" released the film of the military parade, exposing more scenes of deep father-daughter affection.

Kim Jong-un looked at his daughter several times on the podium, and the smiles on their faces never faded. They whispered to each other, and Kim Ju-ae once held up her father's cheeks with both hands. Kim Jong-un responded with a smile.

Other official media images also show that Kim Ju-ae was touching her father's face with her hands while sitting on a sofa in the room, and she was touching Kim Jong-un's chest while walking with her father.
However, the First Lady Ri Sol-ju could only walk behind or sit aside throughout the whole process, and there was always a few steps difference between her and her husband and daughter.

South Korean media pointed out that Kim Ju-ae, who first appeared in public after the test launch of the Hwasong-17 missile on November 18 last year, has appeared more and more frequently in the past three months, and this is the fifth time she has appeared in an official event.

The Korean official media used the most affectionate and noble titles when mentioning Kim Ju-ae, and also broadcasted the scene in which Kim Ju-ae repeatedly shouted that she would die for the white bloodline while looking down on the military parade from the stand.

These signs have led the outside world to suspect that Kim Ju-ae has been predestined as the successor to the Kim regime. The Washington Post analysis believes that "this is a signal that Kim Jong-un has pushed his daughter to the position of successor", but there are also opinions that such a judgment is still too early, and that there are still various possibilities in the case that Kim Jong-un has a son.

Q: Please ask Chongyang Investment to see how the US non-farm employment data in January is far beyond expectations and future trends?

On February 3, the US Department of Labor released the non-farm employment data of January 2023. The number of new non-farm jobs was 517,000, which was far higher than the market expectation of 189,000; the unemployment rate fell to 3.4%, which was the lowest in the past 50 years; the year-on-year growth rate of hourly wages was 4.4%, and the month-on-month growth rate was 0.3%,

From the total amount, this data is affected by many one-time and technical factors, such as the return of striking teachers and workers, the revision of the survey and statistical perspective, and the update of seasonal factors. It may be revised later (refer to the revision of the number of new non-agricultural employment in January 2022 from 504,000 to 364,000), and the non-agricultural employment may not be as strong as the data shows.

From the perspective of structure, the impact of high-tech enterprises on layoffs still exists, but the proportion is low; the new employment in high-contact service industries such as leisure hotels and education and health care has risen sharply, and the data shows that the labor force gap in the service industry still exists.

The rise of service industry PMI, job vacancies and labor shortage data, which are far beyond expectations, as well as the strong consumption credit data, we judge that the US service industry has experienced a rapid recovery after extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that the tight supply and demand in the US labor market cannot be improved without a recession.

Currently, the US labor market has a supply gap of more than 5 million, while the labor participation rate is rising slowly, especially the labor participation rate of 25-54 years old has approached the pre-epidemic high point.
In addition, due to the strong excess savings and consumer credit of American residents, the strong consumption demand will further delay the impact of tightening policy on the labor market.
The tight supply and demand in the US labor market will be the underlying tone of the US economy in 2023.
Adding to the fact that the interest rate hike is close to the end, and the inflation expectation keeps fluctuating, we are not optimistic about the continuous decline of wage growth.
Before the release of this data, the U.S. stock, bond and foreign exchange markets were overly optimistic about the path of interest rate increases by the Federal Reserve.

As inflation data continued to improve, the Fed shortened the pace of interest rate hikes while maintaining a fragile balance of market inflation expectations, but the market ignored the Fed's hawkish rhetoric, not only expecting to stop raising interest rates, but also expecting two rate cuts by the end of the year.

In the context of tight supply and demand in the labor market and uncertain impact of tightening policy, we believe that the Fed's guidance on interest rate hikes at the end of the year is relatively reasonable. The adjustment of extreme expectations and trading congestion may cause some damage to the market.

However, the stubbornness of wage growth will not change the current trend of rapid decline in inflation. With the M2 data turning negative and the leading indicators of various CPI items gradually improving, the U.S. CPI data has turned to a rapid decline phase since October. The stubbornness of wage growth will only form a bottom for future inflation data. The current market expectations are difficult to disprove. After the next inflation data is released, the market may enter a new round of bargaining.<
Zheng Yonggang, the founder of Shanshui, died suddenly of a heart attack. He led the transformation of China's first clothing stock.

Economic Observer reporter Zheng Yuexin February 11, the certification subject Shanshan Holdings Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Shanshan Holdings") WeChat public account issued a notice, Shanshan Enterprise founder, Shanshan Holdings Board of Directors Chairman Zheng Yonggang died of sudden cardiac disease on February 10, 2023, aged 65.

In the 1980s, Zheng Yonggang was the director of a state-owned cotton spinning plant. With the transfer, in 1989, Zheng Yonggang became the director of Ningbo Yunhong Clothing Plant, the predecessor of Shanshui Group.

In December 2022, at the 20th China Enterprise Leaders Forum and the 22nd China Future Star Forum, Zheng Yonggang said in his speech that in the Chinese suit market in the 1990s, the market share of the Shanshan brand once reached 37%.
In 1996, Shanshui Group (600884.SH) was listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange, becoming the first listed company in China’s clothing industry.

Just as the clothing business was at its peak, Shanshan Group began to transform, because Zheng Yonggang realized that “once the market is opened, Chinese brands will naturally form a tiered brand market, and it is unlikely that Shanshan suits will continue to dominate the market and become the national suits of the Chinese people”.

In 1999, SSSC started to research the enterprise transformation. Zheng Yonggang recalled that year, “We came to Shanghai to seek what to do, and we specially found many experts and scholars. We held some Zhuge Liang meetings and theoretical research conferences continuously.
Finally, we set two major strategic directions.
The first direction is new energy and new materials, and the other is big health with a future. ”

After the strategic direction was determined, Shanshui began to seek cooperation. At that time, the carbon research institute of Anshan Heat Energy Institute was doing the national 863 project for Ansteel, but the research and development funds were insufficient. Therefore, Shanshui and the carbon research institute of Anshan Heat Energy Institute signed a cooperation agreement to jointly promote the industrialization of the national 863 project "intermediate phase carbon microspheres", and to develop, produce

In 2001, Shanshui Group achieved the scale production of mesophase pitch microspheres, and began to replace the domestic production. It replaced Japan as the main supplier of mesophase pitch microspheres in China.
This is the first lithium-ion battery negative electrode material production enterprise in China, which realized the nationalization of lithium-ion battery negative electrode material.

With the rapid popularization of lithium batteries, the lithium battery business of Shanshui Group began to develop gradually. In 2007, the lithium battery material business was written into the main business of Shanshui Group. The revenue of clothing business decreased year by year, and in 2013, the revenue of lithium battery material business exceeded that of clothing business.

In February 2021, Shanshui Group successfully acquired LG Chemical’s polarizer business and entered the LCD polarizer market, and established the polarizer enterprise Shanshui Optoelectronics. This field has a high technical content, and Shanshui’s main competitors are all world 500 strong companies, such as Samsung of South Korea, Sumitomo Chemical of Japan, and Nitto Denko.

Zheng Yonggang once shared his experience in post-acquisition management, “The probability of success for Chinese private enterprises to acquire some high-tech enterprises overseas is relatively low. Why do these acquisitions fail?

Because everyone will consider, I spent so much money, I have to send people to manage, this is a common behavior, "However, Zheng Yonggang is different, on the day of the successful acquisition of Shanshan, Zheng Yonggang announced in front of Shansheng Optoelectronics that Shanshan, as a major shareholder of Shansheng, decided to implement a dual system, except that Zheng Yonggang is the chairman, no

ICC Xinfei Information released the negative electrode data in 2022, showing that the sales volume of Shanshui negative electrode in 2022 broke through 200,000 tons, with a year-on-year increase of 100%, and the market share reached 16%, ranking first in the sales volume of artificial graphite negative electrode material.

In the polarizer business, Yano Research statistics show that the market share of the company's subsidiary Sukon Electronics in the global market reached 29% in 2022, and it is expected to reach 32% in 2023, ranking first in the world.

In the first three quarters of 2022, the revenue of Shanshui Shareholding was RMB15.841 billion, and the net profit was RMB2.313 billion. On February 10, the share price of Shanshui Shareholding was RMB19.24 per share, and the total market value was RMB43.6 billion.

On February 9, Shanshui Electric Power Co., Ltd. said on the interactive platform that by the end of 2022, the company’s effective graphitization capacity was about 100,000 tons, and the graphitization capacity of the Meishan project was still in the ramp-up phase.
According to WIND, Zeng Yonggang is still the chairman and actual controller of Shanshui Electric Co., Ltd.
Tianyancha shows that Zheng Yonggang holds a total equity proportion of 40.1% in Shanshan Holding Co., Ltd.

The general manager of Shanshan shares is Li Zhihua, born in 1968. He has served as the chairman of Dongguan Shanshan Battery Materials Co., Ltd., Ningbo Shanshan New Material Technology Co., Ltd., and Hunan Shanshan Energy Technology Co., Ltd., and vice general manager of Ningbo Shanshan Co., Ltd.

On February 10, Shanshan Stock said on the investor interaction platform that there is no relationship of kinship between the senior management of the company and the actual controller of the company.

“Fund E-account” has come: the China Securities Regulatory Commission has authorized the development of the fund E-account, and investors can realize the aggregation and inquiry of all funds under their names - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Economic Observer reporter Chen Shann: The complicated fund purchase channels make it difficult to collect account information?
Always forgetting the "small savings box"?
These problems will also be solved.
On February 10, the China Securities Regulatory Commission announced that the "Fund E Account" APP was available for download in various mobile app stores and was open for public trial operation.

It is reported that "Fund E Account" provides a "one-stop" inquiry service for the account and share information of public funds for individual investors, aiming to solve the industry service pain points such as forgetting accounts and complicated inquiries for a large number of small and medium investors.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there are 156 domestic public fund managers, with a total fund scale of about RMB2.6 trillion; there are 167 public fund share registration institutions and 411 public fund sales institutions.
The account systems of each fund share registration institution are mutually independent, and there is no unified query channel in the industry.
Industry insiders said that by the end of 2021, the number of fund investors in China exceeded 720 million, which means that half of the people in the country have invested in fund products.

Previously, investors had to inquire about their purchase status through different sales institutions, but with the "Fund E Account", they can inquire about the purchase status of all sales channels, and the status of holding funds is clear at a glance.
What is the "Fund E Account" APP?

According to relevant documents, the "Fund E Account" APP is a mobile application developed and built by the China Clearing House, approved by the China Securities Regulatory Commission, and is an industry gateway for the public fund industry. It can provide investors with a one-stop query of the off-market holdings of public fund products.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp the situation of the off-market holdings of the public fund products of the fund managers under the fund managers through all sales channels in the market through the "Fund E Account", and comprehensively improve the query efficiency.

Specifically, the information that investors can query through "Fund E Account" includes: the fund account information opened at the public fund management person in the stock market, the transaction account information opened at the public fund sales institution, and the off-market holding status of the products including open-end securities investment fund and the collective asset management plan managed by the securities company, which is not subject to the 200-person limit.

Liu Yiqian, the head of the business of Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, told the reporter of Economic Observer that investors can get to know their all the holdings of public funds outside the market through the "Fund E Account" App, which helps them to find the "forgotten assets", and more importantly, it helps customers to collect the whole account information of the comprehensive fund investment, so that customers can better grasp their investment situation more timely, accurately and completely, and better optimize
How register for api

The reporter noticed that the "Fund E Account" APP has been available in Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo and other mobile application stores, but the APP is still in the public trial operation stage, and registration requires filling in the invitation code, and investors can contact the fund manager of the fund they hold to obtain it.

A customer service staff of a large-scale public fund in Shanghai provided an invitation code of 6 digits to the reporter of the Economic Observer, and told the reporter, “The APP is in the trial operation stage. The China Clearing provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager. Investors can get them by calling. We will provide them.
After the trial run is over, users can register without the invitation code.

The reporter registered the account and completed the inquiry according to the relevant documents of the download and use of "Fund E Account" published on the official website of the China Securities Regulatory Commission. The whole process took only a few minutes, and it was mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real-name authentication, fund account binding, and public offering fund inquiry.

After the real-name authentication step, click the "asset" fund binding button, and the reporter's all fund products purchased through various fund sales platforms are presented in the binding options list (can be bound accounts), after binding, the total assets of the invested fund can be seen directly and the query function can be started.
It is worth noting that the "Fund E Account" only provides query services for investors and cannot perform redemption and purchase.
The data displayed by the “Fund E Account” is generally the date three trading days before the date on which the user makes the inquiry (T day).

For example, when opening the "Fund E Account" on February 10, the total assets, fund shares and fund net value displayed on the asset page correspond to the date three trading days before the date, i.e. February 7.

Same anti-China, US, Japan, Philippines reach defense consensus
Asia - On February 9, Philippine President Bongbong Marcos visited Japan and held talks with Prime Minister Kishida Fumio.

Both sides reached a consensus on opposing the Chinese invasion of the South China Sea and the East China Sea. The leaders of the Philippines and Japan issued a joint statement after the meeting, saying that they would carry out substantive defense exchanges with the United States through signing a trilateral defense agreement, and oppose the hegemonic policy of the Chinese Communist Party.
According to Japanese media, Kishida hoped to help Japan and the Philippines establish a policy to deal with the Taiwan Strait crisis through this meeting.
Bongbong Marcos visited China in early January this year and reached a $20 billion agreement.
But after that, the China-Philippines relations not only failed to improve, but also declined.
At the beginning of this month, the Philippines and the United States signed an agreement to agree to open more bases to the US military and ensure the security of the South China Sea.
The newly added base is 300 kilometers away from Taiwan, and is the closest location to China.
If there is a crisis in Taiwan, the US military may launch an operation from the base in the Philippines.

Japanese media believes that now Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Australia and even the Philippines have formed an axis with the United States, and built an "anti-China arc" in the West Pacific to promote regional cooperation.
Vice Chairman of the Kuomintang Party Hsia Lishen Visits China to Convey Song Tao's Message: Welcomes Green Camp to Visit the Mainland under the Consensus of 1992

Xia Liyanyan, Vice Chairman of the Kuomintang in Taiwan, met with Song Tao, head of the Taiwan Affairs Office of the State Council, and Wang Huning, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee and Secretary of the Central Secretariat, during his visit to China.

Chao Chun-shan, a senior advisor to the Nationalist Party’s official organization, the National Politics Foundation, was interviewed by the Central News Agency of Taiwan last night. He actively evaluated Song Tao’s statement to Hsia Li-yen that China welcomes green camp members to visit the mainland as long as they recognize the “1992 Consensus” and oppose Taiwan independence.
The Kuomintang side evaluated that it was a new thing.
The news of the same day did not mention this statement when Andrew Hsia met with Song Tao.
The ruling Kuomintang in Taiwan has been clarifying its rejection of the “1992 Consensus” for several days.

According to the Central News Agency today, the vice chairman of the Kuomintang, Xia Liyanyan, led a delegation to visit the mainland. During his stay in Beijing, he met with Wang Huning, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee and Secretary of the Central Secretariat, the new head of the Taiwan Affairs Office, Song Tao, and the secretary of the Beijing Municipal Party Committee, You Li.
Chao Chun-shan, senior advisor of the KMT’s National Politics Foundation, said at the meeting that the KMT’s “92 Consensus” is the original “92 Consensus”.
Chao Chun-shan analyzed that this was different from the feelings of the previous meetings he participated in.

Recently, in the video conference with the mainland academic community, as well as this conference, I did not hear the Taiwan scholars talk about the military reunification and the "Anti-Splitting Law", but instead, they talked about the restoration of communication and dialogue.
Chao Chun-shan pointed out that the situation on the Taiwan Strait is tense, and the mainland hopes to convey its intention to improve relations through the KMT.

Because there is no mutual trust between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party of China, the other side still wants to do a good job in the work of Taiwanese people, and the representative does not want the relationship between the two sides to be ruined.

According to Chao Chunshan, Wang Huning also gave specific instructions to Song Tao to say, "You must implement the requirements of the farmers and fishermen in Taiwan", and if it is impossible to solve the problem comprehensively, it should be solved on a case-by-case basis.

The report did not mention whether the Nationalist Party people visited the mainland and mentioned the daily harassment of Taiwan by Chinese military aircraft and warships, as well as the agricultural and fishing problems in some counties and cities in Taiwan, and whether the Central News Agency reporter asked these questions.
French trade unions again mobilize against government pension reform

On Saturday (February 11), the French trade unions again launched a nationwide mobilization against the government’s draft retirement reform, calling on the people to take to the streets to express their opinions.
This is the fourth action day of the social movement against the government's pension reform proposal.
how many people responded to the call for the rally may affect the next action plan of the trade union group.

This is the fourth time that the eight major trade unions in France have jointly launched a nationwide mobilization in one month, and it is the first time that the protest has arranged the rally on Saturday.

As Saturday is a public holiday for most French people, they do not have to choose between participating in the demonstration or going on strike to lose wages, so the trade unions hope that the gathering today will attract more people to participate.

The trade unions of the public transport system, the subway and the public railway did not call for a strike today, so the public transport system should operate normally, and citizens can take the bus to the rally site. At the same time, in the areas where schools start winter vacation, people can take a holiday normally.

The trade unions hope that more than one million people will participate in the rally today, while the police expect that the number of people participating in the rally nationwide may be between 600,000 and 800,000, and 90,000 to 120,000 people may gather in the Paris downtown area.

Since the anti-government pension reform protest began, although polls show that most French people do not support the measure to postpone the legal retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people who actually take to the streets to participate in the march has gradually decreased.
The first strike demonstration on January 31 gathered 1.27 million to 2.5 million people across the country.
And the number of demonstrators on Tuesday (February 7) has shrunk to between 757,000 and two million nationwide.
This pension reform plan is currently under discussion in the French National Assembly.
The opposition parties, especially the left-wing opposition, have submitted countless amendments, which has slowed down the review process.
And the argument between the ruling and opposition parties is becoming more and more fierce.

A member of the radical left party France Insoumise recently posted a picture of himself standing on a balloon with the image of the Minister of Labour on it on social media, which provoked the ruling party to protest.

The President of the National Assembly finally announced that the member of parliament would be banned from participating in the activities of the National Assembly for 15 days as a punishment for this behavior.
Although this reform plan has triggered the largest social movement in France in the past 20 years, the government has made slight adjustments to the draft, but has not made any major concessions.
The trade unions have prepared to launch another action on Thursday, March 16, and also plan to organize a demonstration on March 7 when the reform bill is discussed in the Senate.
China encourages higher birth rate, encourages college students to donate sperm

On September 9, the Yunnan Human Sperm Bank issued a promotion to solicit people with a college degree or above or students to donate sperm. Successful donors who donate sperm 8 to 12 times can receive a subsidy of RMB 4,500.
According to the Taiwan media report today, the message went viral on Weibo and triggered many provinces and cities such as Zhejiang, Shaanxi, Hubei, Shandong and Beijing to follow the initiative.
According to the report signed by the Liberty Times, China encourages college students to donate sperm.

The requirements for donating sperm in Beijing are the highest among all the universities in China. In addition to the requirement of education, the donors must be at least 170 cm tall, have a good appearance, no obvious hair loss, and the nearsightedness cannot be more than 600 degrees.

According to the report, the Yunnan Human Sperm Bank pointed out that donors can get a full set of urological examination worth RMB 1,000. "Especially the semen and chromosome detection, most people have never done it, which is of great significance to understand their reproductive status."

The requirements for donors include a height of 165cm or above, a college degree or above, or currently enrolled in college, no color blindness or color weakness, no genetic diseases or infectious diseases such as B hepatitis.

According to the report, the Shaanxi Human Sperm Bank has a promotional poster that reads "Paid sperm donation is a great honor", calling on young people to respond to sperm donation and encouraging netizens to forward related information, "to spread love".

The price in Shaanxi is higher than that in Yunnan. Those who meet the requirements can receive RMB 300 in cash each time, and those who donate sperm for a certain number of times can receive RMB 5,000 as a subsidy.
However, the highest price is in Beijing, with the highest subsidy of 5150 yuan.
The last East German Communist Party Prime Minister has died
Hans Modrow (as Prime Minister of East Germany)
Therefore, we have lost an important leader.
On November 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall was opened, which had separated East and West Berlin for 28 years, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democracy.
At the time, the Communist leaders were forced to resign as protesters across East Germany demanded democracy and freedom.
Gorbachev, who came to power in the Soviet Union, had demanded reforms in the Soviet-dominated Eastern Europe.
On March 18, 1990, Mitterrand announced the first and only free elections in the history of the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election results led to his resignation as chancellor.
Despite his reforms, opponents accused him of trying to delay the political changes and reunification that took place in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to rebrand rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Modrow was convicted of election fraud in the 1989 municipal elections, but did not go to jail.
The U.S. Justice Department denied the charges were politically motivated.
Mr Modrow continued to serve in the German parliament from 1990 to 1994 and was a member of the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
Moderow saw himself as a reformer and wanted to change the party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters he did not want the old East Germany back, but said its achievements should be acknowledged.
Moldenhauer was born in Jasenitz, a small town in what was then Germany in 1928 and trained as a mechanic.
He served as a youth fire brigade lieutenant during World War Two and was a member of the Nazi militia Volkssturm in the final days of the conflict, which recruited men aged 16 to 60 to fight.
At 17, Modrow was captured by Soviet troops and taken as a prisoner of war to the Soviet Union, where he took part in anti-fascist courses and became a committed communist.
In 1949, the year the GDR was founded, he returned home and found work as a mechanic, continuing his studies in social sciences and economics and earning a doctorate.

Moderow was a member of the Free German Youth, which almost all East Germans joined, and rose through the ranks of the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED) to become chairman of the party in the Dresden region from 1973 to 1989.
He also held a seat in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
He became the de facto leader of East Germany in 1990, taking the highest national office.
Iran marks anniversary of revolution as hackers hack president's speech

Iran's Islamic Republic held an official rally on Saturday to mark the 44th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution, but anti-government hackers briefly interrupted President Ibrahim Raisi's televised speech.
The president's live television address was interrupted on the internet for about a minute, with a screen showing a group of anti-government hackers who call themselves "Edalat Ali (Ali Justice)."
There was also a voice shouting "Death to the Islamic Republic."
Hackers disrupt state TV report on Iran's revolution anniversary, Reuters reports today.

Iran's official commemoration of the 44th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution was marred by the boldest challenge yet to President Ebrahim Raisi's hardline government from young protesters demanding they step down, but Raisi still called on "deceived youth" to repent so they could be forgiven by the supreme leader.
The nationwide protests swept Iran after the death in custody of Mahsa Amini, 22, in September under the country's morality police.
The crackdown by Iran's security forces on protests is one of the biggest challenges to the Islamic Republic since the 1979 revolution overthrew a 2,500-year-old monarchy.

As part of a pardon for the anniversary of the revolution, Iranian authorities released on Friday the jailed dissident Farhad Meysami and the Iranian-French scholar Fariba Adelkhah, who had gone on a hunger strike.
Earlier, supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued a pardon that included some of the prisoners detained in the recent anti-government protests.
According to the human rights group HRANA, as of Friday, 528 protesters had been killed, including 71 minors.
Another 70 government security personnel were killed.
As many as 19,763 protesters have been arrested.
For weeks, Iranian leaders and state media have called for a vote at Saturday's rallies to show support for the government and against the protests.
On Friday evening, as part of a government-sponsored celebration marking the anniversary of the Iranian revolution, state media showed fireworks as people chanted "Allahu Akbar!
(Allahu Akbar!)”.
However, many people could be heard shouting "Death to the Dictator!
"Death to the Islamic Republic" and "Death to Khamenei" in videos posted on social media.
On Saturday, state television broadcast live footage of official rallies in all provinces.
In Tehran, as part of the official celebrations, indigenous anti-ballistic missiles, drones, anti-submarine cruisers and other military equipment were on display.
President Raisi's speech was frequently interrupted by chants of "Death to America," a signature slogan at the provincial rallies.
The crowd also chanted, "Death to Israel."

Adelkhah, who has been in jail in Iran since 2019, is one of seven French nationals detained in the country, a factor in the worsening relations between Paris and Tehran in recent months, Reuters said.
She was sentenced to five years in prison in 2020 on charges of endangering national security.
They later put her under house arrest, but she returned to prison in January.
Adelkhah denied the charges.
A week before Mesbahi was released, supporters warned he was at risk of death from a hunger strike.
He was arrested in 2018 for protesting the compulsory wearing of the headscarf.
The French Foreign Ministry on Friday responded to Adelkhah's release, calling for her freedom to be restored, "including if she wishes, allowing her to return to France.
The balloon incident has made the US eyes brighter?
USA restricts nuclear technology exports to China
According to the Wall Street Journal report today, after the balloon incident, the United States is preparing to further tighten its export of technology to China.

Current and former security officials said that the balloon incident highlighted the national security threat posed by China and would provide more political support for strengthening the protection of American technology.
The US claimed that the balloon carried antennas and sensors for intelligence gathering and communication.
Martijn Rasser, a former senior official of the US Central Intelligence Agency and now working at the Washington think tank Center for a New American Security, said.
"This is undoubtedly pouring oil on the fire, supporting the hardliners against China. "

Karine Jean-Pierre, the White House press secretary, told reporters on Thursday, "We will also consider taking a broader range of actions to expose and counter China's larger-scale surveillance activities, which pose a threat to our national security and to our allies and partners.
“U.S. officials said they have notified more than 30 governments about the balloon incident, and international coordination is crucial to counter the Chinese threat.

Emily Benso, a senior researcher at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, said that in addition to the actions of the Biden administration, the newly established Special Committee on Strategic Competition between the United States and the Communist Party of China in the US House of Representatives may also put pressure on the United States to take more severe measures to slow down China's development.
She said that members of Congress will feel more and more pressure to take a stronger stance, which may force the White House to take a stronger policy.
Many people who advocate for stricter export controls are also pushing to expand the scope of control to include industries such as artificial intelligence, the Wall Street Journal said.
The US government has also been formulating a plan to review foreign investment, to see if there are potential national security threats from China in US investments overseas.
Analysts said that the White House may face calls to launch the plan faster.
Turkey and Syria Earthquake Relief Day and Night

Since the strong earthquake occurred between Turkey and the neighboring Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have been working day and night in the ruins of thousands of collapsed buildings to rescue survivors buried under the rubble.
In the cold, they often call for silence as they try to hear any sign of life from the rubble of concrete.
Two more women have been rescued from the rubble of the earthquake after surviving for days, Reuters reported today.
But the death toll from the quake has risen to 24,150.
The death toll in Turkey stands at 20,665, while more than 3,500 people have died in Syria.

The 7.8 magnitude quake that struck on Monday, followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and approaching the 31,000 deaths caused by an earthquake in neighboring Iran in 2003.
A similar strong earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 killed more than 17,000.
Two women have been rescued from the rubble of collapsed buildings in Turkey 122 hours after being trapped in the region's deadliest earthquake in 20 years, authorities said on Saturday.
Another injured man, 55, was identified as Masallah Cicek, who was rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakr, the largest city in south-eastern Turkey.
Rescuers often call for silence in the cold temperatures as they try to hear any signs of life from the rubble of crumbling concrete.
In Samandag district in Turkey, rescuers crouched under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they gingerly reached into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
He opened his eyes as baby Yagiz Ulas was wrapped in a warm blanket and carried to a field hospital.
Video images showed rescuers carrying his mother, who was on a stretcher, dazed and pale but conscious.
Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters overnight that 67 people had been rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours, and that 31,000 rescue workers had been deployed in the disaster zone.
He said about 80,000 people were being treated in hospitals, while 1.05 million people were left homeless by the quake and were crammed into temporary shelters.
As many people lack food in the cold winter conditions, the public is increasingly questioning the response of the two leaders to the disaster.
President Bashar al-Assad of Syria and his wife, Asma, visited a hospital in Aleppo, the first time he has traveled to an area affected by the earthquake, according to Syrian state media.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said it was running out of stocks in rebel-held northwest Syria because of the war's complications.
On Friday, Erdogan visited the province of Adiyaman in Turkey, where he acknowledged that the government's response had not been as fast as expected.
Opponents have seized on the issue to attack Erdogan, who is seeking re-election in a vote on May 14 but may have to delay it because of the disaster.
Reuters said anger over the delayed aid and the slow start to rescue efforts could affect the election.
Even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the most serious challenge to Erdogan's 20 years in power.
Erdogan called for unity and denounced what he called a "negative campaign for political interests."
Kemal Kilicdaroglu, leader of the main opposition party, criticized the government's response.
Critics said "the earthquake was big, but what is even bigger is the lack of coordination, planning and incompetence.

Hanoi - VNA Special correspondent reports that on the morning of February 11, during his visit to Brunei Darussalam, Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife visited the University of Brunei Darussalam (UBD, or Brunei University).
The University of Brunei Darussalam is the largest higher education and scientific research center in Brunei, and ranks third in the regional university rankings.
The University of Brunei Darussalam is one of the symbols of Vietnam-Brunei cooperation in education and training.
The University of Brunei Darussalam officially established cooperation with FPT University of Vietnam in July 2013, with the main cooperation areas being English training.
In addition to English, French, moral education, Japanese and Korean, the University of Brunei Darussalam also includes Vietnamese in its teaching curriculum.
During the visit to the University of Brunei Darussalam, Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife exchanged with students of Vietnamese language class.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh is delighted to see more and more foreigners like to learn Vietnamese, and he hopes to make positive contributions to promoting Vietnamese culture and people’s customs to the world.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh expressed his belief and hope that the Vietnamese language teaching staff at the University of Brunei Darussalam will become stronger and stronger; the students in the Vietnamese language class will become more and more interested in Vietnamese language, and make efforts to learn it, so that they can use Vietnamese fluently and become envoys of the friendly and cooperative relations between Vietnam and Brunei.

During this opportunity, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also communicated with Vietnamese students studying English at the FPT-UBD Global Center in Da Nang via video to understand their learning situation, especially during the pandemic.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh believes that the cooperation between FPT University and Brunei University, especially the FPT-UBD Global Center, is a vivid symbol of the educational cooperation between Vietnam and Brunei.

At the same time, he hoped that the students of the center would make greater progress in their studies and make positive contributions to the friendly and cooperative relations between Vietnam and Brunei.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh highly appreciated the results of the cooperation between the two countries in education, including the cooperation between FPT University and the University of Brunei Darussalam, as well as the University of Brunei Darussalam’s inclusion of Vietnamese language in its curriculum, when he met with the Minister of Education of Brunei and the leaders of the University of Brunei Darussalam.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh hoped that the University of Brunei Darussalam would continue to pay attention to ensuring the quality of Vietnamese language teaching and further expand the scale of Vietnamese language classes.

Prime Minister of the Government of Vietnam Pham Minh Chinh also highly appreciated the positive results of the cooperation between the two countries based on the Memorandum of Understanding on Education Cooperation signed in April 2014; and suggested that Brunei continue to provide more scholarships and effectively carry out various short-term exchange training projects such as the Global Discovery Programme and the Discovery Year.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh highly appreciated the University of Brunei Darussalam for setting up its first branch in Southeast Asia in Vietnam; believed that the university would grow in scale in the region and the world; and further expand its cooperation with Vietnamese universities.
On this occasion, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife planted a memorial tree in the campus of the University of Brunei Darussalam and left a message in the memorial book.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh wished that the University of Brunei Darussalam would continue to develop and contribute more and more to the education sector of Brunei Darussalam, and also to deepen and broaden the cooperation with Vietnamese educational and training institutions.
(End)

Strengthening relations with Singapore and Brunei is the need of each country, and is committed to improving the well-being of the people of each country, and is committed to peace, stability and development in the region and the world.

At all meetings and talks, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and the leaders of Singapore and Brunei agreed to strengthen political trust with Vietnam through high-level delegation exchanges, effective implementation of bilateral cooperation mechanisms and important cooperation agreements.

Among them, the Memorandum of Understanding on Green and Digital Economy Partnership with Singapore and the Action Plan to Strengthen the Comprehensive Partnership between Vietnam and Brunei for the period of 2023-2027 are two highlights.

This visit not only helps to deepen Vietnam's cooperation with Singapore and Brunei in traditional fields such as politics, diplomacy, economy, security, defense, education and training, oil and gas, tourism, and people-to-people exchanges, but also creates a framework for cooperation in new potential fields such as digital economy, green economy, energy transition, innovation and creativity, smart city building, and sustainable development.

What is the "object" that was shot down in the sky over Alaska?
The case is still a mystery.
The US military used its most advanced stealth fighter F-22 to shoot down an unidentified object flying in the sky of Alaska on Friday afternoon (February 10).
The object was shot down 10 miles off the coast of Alaska.
This is the second time that the US military has shot down an airborne object in less than a week.
Last Saturday, a Chinese spy balloon that had been drifting in the US airspace for several days was shot down near the coast of South Carolina.

The second object was first detected in US airspace on Thursday night and was tracked by the US military as it moved over northeastern Alaska, flying at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), which is about the size of a small car, much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down previously.
The Pentagon also said there was no indication that the object was maneuverable.

John Kirby, the strategic communications coordinator for the White House National Security Council, said on Friday that while the exact nature of the object flying at high altitude was unclear, it "posed a reasonable threat to the safety of commercial aviation."
Kirby said the object was different from the one found in U.S. airspace, as it did not have a "payload" hanging from it.
"We call it an object because that's the best description we can give it at this point," Kirby said.
President Biden made the decision to shoot down the object after receiving advice from the Pentagon, and he did so "very carefully," Kirby added.
The US official description of the object is roughly: the size of a small car, no control rod, no hanging device, and flying at an altitude of about 10,000 meters.
But these details still do not answer the basic questions, such as what the object is, which country it belongs to, and what mission it is on.
At present, many analyses and speculations on the Internet believe that this may be another Chinese balloon.
It may be like the spy balloon that invaded the US airspace and the Chinese balloon that floated over Latin America, which may come from China and perform some tasks at different locations.
Some people also associate the object in Alaska with "unidentified flying objects" (UFO).

The report of the American news weekly quotes Peter Meijer, a former member of the U.S. House of Representatives, who tweeted on Friday, "I hope this 'unidentified flying object' is also a spy balloon, not a legitimate UFO. "
“It’s a bit of a joke to mix up an alien spacecraft with a weather balloon, but it’s not worth starting an interstellar conflict over,” Meijer said.
Meijer sent the tweet shortly after it was confirmed that the object in Alaska had been shot down.
Newsweek said that Meijer was not the only one who doubted that the object was a UFO.

Republican Rep. Tim Burchett of Tennessee criticized the government's cover-up of the information last month and called on the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to release a report on the "unidentified flying object".
