I don't recommend reading it.
I read it not too long ago and reviewed it.
In fact, The Locum Life is his fourth book.
The tone of this book is extremely plain, like plain water, and the words and sentences are extremely simple, and the plot is like a quiet street in the afternoon in summer.
Each has a start, a middle and an end, albeit never final.
And finally, they are collected together and named as “What We Talk About When We Talk About Love”.

I think this collection of short stories and its title is like a performance art. The author wants to express that love is not only the ups and downs on the stage, the legends of the city, nor the sticky glue of you and me. Love is not only represented by the above nor should it be represented by the above. Love is also the life of the plain water, the dull day after day, the helplessness of life, the escape from reality, and the confusion of the future.<
When you read this book, you may recall the quarreling couple around you, the dull marriage of people you know, and the unsatisfactory love affairs.

This is exactly why I don't recommend reading it. From the perspective of aesthetics, the writing and plot of this book are dull and tasteless. Unless your life is full of ups and downs or sweet as living in a candy castle, you will feel bored and indifferent when reading it.

And from the perspective of thought depth, the daily scenes did not make people open their eyes or expand their thoughts and views (this is different from Marquez's "Love in the Time of Cholera"), and the short fragments did not discuss any problems, such as what kind of mistakes led to the failure of love?
Reason for marriage breakdown
So I would not recommend you to read this book. It doesn’t matter whether you read it or not.
The author's ideas are expressed more through techniques and genres than through the plot, which is the reason why the reading experience of this book is not good.
It is suitable for a quick read, but not for a careful reading.
The logic of the book is good, but the content is not enough.
It explains a lot of sales theories, what they are and why, but it is weak in how to do it. It only points out the direction but does not give specific methods.
Also, this book feels like a patchwork.
They come from the earth and, unlike canvas and oil, they give grudgingly.
Whether it is a story compiled for the purpose of examples, if the author gives some examples of his own experience, it will be more convincing.

>
Customer needs might change, but
The title still refers to customers, but in the body of the text it becomes customers.
There are also problems with typos, missing punctuation marks, and incorrect numbering in e-books.
In short, this book is a good choice for those who want to learn the theory of sales, but it is not suitable for those who are already engaged in sales work and want to improve their sales skills.
A quick guide to internet finance

This book is very shallow, and can be said to be only an introductory course, which can help everyone quickly understand the whole picture of Internet finance, but to deeply understand it, you still have to follow the clues and dig it yourself.

Moreover, the book was published at an early time, and the content of the Alipay WeChat loan subsidy war that cultivates user habits was not mentioned, and the current third-party payment share is probably not as small as the book said.
Nowadays, many people go out to eat with their mobile phones. Merchants also give up using UnionPay because of the high bank flow.

But I am still very grateful to the author for writing this introductory book. It is obvious that the author has at least several years of financial observation experience, and is very familiar with the history of domestic and foreign financial development. That is why he can write such easy-to-understand contents.
It is easy to write big and empty words, but it is difficult to write in plain language.
I appreciate you, and I want you to know it!
The first factor that determines a person's job satisfaction is not the salary level, but whether he or she is sufficiently valued and appreciated in the workplace.
According to Maslow’s Hierarchy, humans are innately selfish and need to fulfill their basic needs.

Indeed, for the Chinese, most of them are “love you in the heart but can’t open the mouth”. Even if they have love, gratitude and appreciation, they will keep them in their hearts and won’t say them out.
The author elaborates five languages of appreciation in this book: affirmative words, quality time, service, gifts, and physical touch.

I think it is not important that you know what the five languages of appreciation are, but that you can appreciate and be grateful to the people around you, whether they are your family, friends or colleagues, at any time and place.
In fact, the closer the relationship is, the more appreciation and gratitude is needed. Only in this way can our life become more beautiful.
If you learn to appreciate others, you can retain talents to a certain extent and reduce the resignation rate.
We would like to give thanks to the translators for bringing us the wonderful thoughts and the world from abroad.
Due to the cultural background of the East and the West, there will be some differences between languages. If you have the opportunity to see the original version of the author, you will gain more.
Thank you again for the authors, translators and editors for their hard work!
